title: Video Editor Trainee / Junior Wedding Editor (DaVinci Resolve / Premiere Pro)
description:
We are a small team specializing in wedding video editing. We create emotional highlight reels and are looking for someone with a good eye for 
nts and a feel for music.



The work is split into two separate paid tasks:



Shot Selection (Cuts): You will receive raw footage and a reference music track. Your task is to select the best shots and make rough cuts – essentially choosing the 
nts that tell the story. Payment for this stage: $17.50 per project.



Assembly on Timeline: After the selection is approved, you will arrange those clips on the timeline perfectly synced to the beat of the music, add simple speed ramps or slow-motion where needed, and prepare the video for client review. Later, you will also implement any revision requests. Payment for this stage: $25.40 per project.



Note: Color grading and audio mixing are not required – we handle those separately.



Who we are looking for:

We are primarily looking for beginners with no experience – we will train you. However, we are also open to candidates who already know DaVinci Resolve or Adobe Premiere Pro and have some editing experience.



Training plan:

We provide step-by-step training, starting with shot selection (understanding what makes a good wedding 
nt) and then moving to beat-synced assembly.



The first training project (shot selection only) is unpaid – it's a mutual test to see if you like the work and we like your style.



After that, you will start with real projects and receive payment per stage as described above.



How to apply:

Please fill out a short Google Form 
. 



We will contact selected candidates via
. You can find us by adding the phone number 
. 



Response time: We reply within 24 hours (GMT+3, 5 hours behind Manila). Our working hours are 9 AM – 7 PM (2 PM – 12 AM Manila time).

title: CRM Admin
description:
We are hiring!



At Destination NJ, we redefine the real estate experience by offering a comprehensive suite of services tailored to our Realtor Partners’ needs. What sets us apart is our unique approach – our clients work with a dedicated team rather than a single agent, providing an unparalleled level of service.



Unlike traditional models that spread resources thin, we believe in dividing labor among specialized professionals. This approach allows us to concentrate on the areas where we excel, ensuring that our clients receive the highest level of expertise throughout their real estate journey. We look forward to welcoming a dynamic and proactive Customer Relationship Manager (CRM) administrator to our team! We need someone who is proficient in both Follow Up Boss and Go High Level



Responsibilities:

-Implement and configure Action Plans within the Follow Up Boss and Go High Level platform to enhance workflow efficiency.

-Maintain and update client profiles, ensuring accuracy and completeness.

-Provide support to agents in effectively managing their client interactions within the CRMs

-Regularly review manual data entries in our CRMs for accuracy and completeness.

-Send timely reminders to agents regarding pending tasks and follow-ups.

-Facilitate the creation of home searches and configure auto
 search for agents within MLS platforms.



Secondary Responsibilities:

-Assisting our other back end tea
mbers in contract prep (training provided)

-Facilitate the creation of home searches and configure auto
 search for agents within MLS platforms.

-Agent support and ad-hoc tasks as assigned



Requirements

-Familiarity or experience with MLS Platforms ie GSMLS, BrightMLS, etc is mandatory

-Experience with Follow Up Boss is mandatory

-Experience with Go High Level s is mandatory

-Experience with Productivity Tools ie Clickup, Asana, etc

-High speed internet (at least 25Mbps)



Desired Attributes:

-Collaborative approach and ability to work effectively within a team.

-Demonstrates trustworthiness, respect and maintains a positive attitude in the workplace.

-Takes complete ownership of assigned tasks and responsibilities.

-Can work with little to no supervision, displaying initiative in tasks.

-Bonus if you have worked in New Jersey Real Estate specifically

-Demonstrates a quick and effective response to inquiries and tasks.



TRAINING: This will be a 5 days a week, 4 hour shift. Training for the first two weeks would have additional hours starting at 9AM EST.

AFTER TRAINING, your shift schedule will start at 4-8 PM EST on Monday-Friday. You will have 8 paid vacation days/ sick days that start accruing after just 3 months with the company. This is in addition to the paid holidays we provide - Good Friday, Thanksgiving, Christmas and New Year.



How to Apply:

Interested candidates are invited to submit their resume along with a brief cover letter to Vera at 
 ensure your application receives proper attention, please include your favorite food in the subject line. This small detail will let us know that you've thoroughly read the entire job listing.

title: Real Estate Virtual Assistant (REVA)
description:
We are looking for a highly organized and proactive Real Estate Virtual Assistant (REVA) to support our growing real estate operations. The ideal candidate should have 1–2 years of proven experience as a real estate VA, excellent communication skills, and the ability to manage lead follow-ups, CRM systems, and digital interactions effectively.



TO APPLY: Please include your resume link and portfolio link. Only candidates with real estate VA experience will be considered.



Key Responsibilities:



Manage and respond to incoming leads promptly and professionally.

Handle direct messages (DMs) across platforms including
, Instagram, LinkedIn, etc.

Maintain community engagement and consistently interact with potential clients.

Manage and update CRM systems such as Follow Up Boss, Go High Level, KVCore, and Trello.

Input new contacts and ensure proper lead management and follow-ups.

Create and maintain an organized CRM system for tracking prospects, contracts, and client communication.

Support social media and digital marketing efforts, including managing inquiries and routing qualified leads.

Assist with graphics, website updates, and social media management (SMM) tasks as needed.

Learn and adapt quickly to new tools, workflows, and real estate systems.

1–2 years of experience as a Real Estate Virtual Assistant or in a similar role.

Strong working knowledge of KVCore, Follow Up Boss, and/or Go High Level (preferred).

Experience managing multiple platforms and responding to messages efficiently.

Excellent written and verbal communication skills in English.

Able to work night shift (PST hours) and available to start immediately.

Must have a reliable device, stable internet connection, and home office setup.

Experience with contracts, basic graphics, website management, and SMM is preferred.

Part time potential to full time after few weeks



TO APPLY: Please include your resume link. Only candidates with real estate VA experience will be considered.

title: Data Entry PCS - Permanent WFH
description:
Company Overview



Join the leader transforming healthcare waste management across America.



MedPro Disposal is the nation's largest privately-held medical waste management company, serving 35,000+ providers across 48 states in a $2+ billion market. Since 2009, we've been the trusted partner helping healthcare facilities save up to 30% on waste management costs while maintaining 99% on-time service.



What we do: We lead with comprehensive medical waste disposal solutions, plus pharmaceutical waste management, secure document destruction, and compliance training services—all powered by innovative technology and a client-first approach.



Why it matters: We handle the critical but complex challenge of medical waste management so healthcare providers can focus on what they do best: delivering exceptional patient care.



Our impact: From physician practices to hospitals, dental offices to long-term care facilities, we're trusted advisors and strategic partners—not just vendors. We combine proven expertise with environmental responsibility and comprehensive protection to solve complex operational challenges.



Ready to grow with us?



Join a fast-scaling, mission-driven company where we Do The Right Thing, roll up our sleeves with a "figure it out" attitude, and win as a team. We're building something meaningful—making healthcare safer, more compliant, and more efficient—one client at a time.



WORK REMOTELY: YES

TYPE: Non-voice

WORK HOURS & SCHEDULE: Monday - Friday; 8AM - 4:30PM CST

WORK DURATION: Full-time

RATE& SALARY: $400, PAID WEEKLY!



Benefits:

Paid Leaves after 6 months of employment!

Work anniversary bonus!

No work with pay during US Holidays!

Fixed Saturday and Sunday off

Weekly salary

Permanent work-from-home





DESCRIPTION AND INFORMATION: We are looking for efficient, dedicated loyal individuals that can contribute to our goal of being the best in class for a healthcare waste disposal company in the United States.



Key Responsibilities:

- Data Entry

- Creating Customers account





Qualifications:



- Bachelor’s degree in a related field or equivalent combination of education and experience

- 1-2 years experience with Data Entry and account creation is a MUST

- With virtual assistance/work-from-home experience

- Must have excellent oral and written English communication kills

- Familiar with CRM, SalesForce

- Exceptional computer skills, including Microsoft Office and databases

- Consistent, accurate, and with an eye for details

- Exceptional organizational skills and aptitude for numbers

- Able to thrive in a deadline-driven environment

- Resilient – Can work with less supervision, adapt to a fast-paced environment, and multi-task effectively





Basic Technical Requirements:

- Your own laptop/desktop PC with the following minimum specs: i5 5th gen and above/AMD equivalent; 8GB RAM; Mozilla or Chrome installed; Windows 10 upwards.

- A consistent and stable internet connection of at least 20Mbps with a backup internet connection

- Noise-canceling headset/headphones

-A quiet and dedicated workspace at home





HOW TO APPLY: Interested and Qualified Candidates may send the following to 



1. An updated and comprehensive resume.



2. Record a 1–2-minute audio or video introducing yourself and explaining why you are interested in the job. Should be recorded using Vocaroo or Loom, and the link should be shared with us for easy access.





EEO Statement

MedPro Disposal is an equal-opportunity employer committed to fostering a diverse and inclusive workplace. We encourage individuals from all backgrounds to apply.

title: Serviced Accommodation Operations Manager (Standards + QA)
description:
We are a UK-based property investment and serviced accommodation (SA) management company. We operate seven serviced accommodation units and focus on delivering a consistent, high-standard guest experience through strong operational systems and quality control. Alongside SA operations, we run two to three active refurbishment/development projects at any given time, coordinating contractors, procurement, documentation, and stakeholder communication to deliver projects efficiently and to a high standard.



This is a hands-on Operations Lead role responsible for execution across our serviced accommodation portfolio and coordination support across refurbishment/development projects. Your core focus is proactive quality control and consistent delivery: you’ll enforce standards through checklists and evidence, ensure guests have a smooth end-to-end experience, and reduce recurring issues by continuously improving SOPs. In parallel, you’ll support project coordination for refurbishments by running follow-ups with contractors and suppliers, managing documentation, and scheduling appointments to keep workstreams moving without drift.



We’re hiring an Operations Lead who can run a cadence, enforce quality standards, and coordinate delivery across both serviced accommodation and active refurb projects.



Monday- Sunday:10:00-18:00 ( with 1 hour break) UK time, Saturday or Sunday off for one day.

Salary :700 USD Per month+ KPI bonus



Core responsibilities

Serviced Accommodation operations (delivery + standards)

- Enforce unit standards using checklists, photo evidence, and “definition of done” quality bars.

- Manage guest communications: fast responses, professional tone, calm resolution, and proactive updates.

- Maintain an issues/defects log and ensure issues are fully closed with root-cause prevention (not just “ticket closed”).

- Coordinate cleaners and operational VAs: confirm turnovers, verify quality, and drive consistent performance.

- Monitor pricing and availability: check pricing rules are being applied, flag risks/opportunities, and escalate recommendations.

- Create and update listings: listing setup, copy accuracy, amenities, house rules, photo requirements, and platform compliance (
 as applicable).

- Maintain and improve SOPs: update processes based on recurring issues, guest feedback, and operational learnings.

Property project coordination (admin execution)

- Maintain a project tracker for tasks, owners, due dates, and blockers.

- Source and compare quotes: produce a quote comparison table and recommendation.

- Follow-up with contractors, suppliers, utilities, council, other professional, keep reference numbers, paper trail, and next-step ownership.

- Documentation: build/format/update project packs, submissions, and version control.

- Appointment scheduling: inspections, contractor visits, deliveries, surveys, and access coordination.

Reporting directly to company CEO



Tools and working style

- We use Lark for communication, tracking, and internal workflows.

- Google Drive for document storage and document control.

- PMS/pricing tools as applicable (Hostaway/PriceLabs or similar).



Must-have experience

- Evidence-based quality control: Create and used checklists/audits/photo evidence used to enforce standards and reduce recurring issues.

- Serviced accommodation or hospitality ops: guest comms + turnover coordination + issue resolution.

- Property management working experience

- Vendor/contractor coordination: proactive follow-up, scheduling, and timeline control.

- Strong written English: crisp guest messaging and concise leadership updates.

- SOP ownership: has maintained/improved SOPs based on operational reality, not just followed them.

Nice-to-have experience

- Listing creation and optimization (
).

- Pricing/availability monitoring and familiarity with revenue management tools (e.g., PriceLabs).

- Property management operations or refurb coordination admin.

Personality traits we’re looking for

- Conscientious and detail-accurate.

- Proactive follow-up and ownership mindset.

- Structured and process-driven (lives in checklists/trackers).

- Calm, professional, and solution-oriented with guests and vendors.

- Improves systems continuously rather than firefighting repeatedly.

- Well organised with multiple task and able to prioritise



Hiring process:

Step 1: Answer the Google link below (required) and follow the instructions after.

Step 2: Answer scenario based questions

Step 3: Join 20-minute screening call

Step 4: Paid trial task

Step 5: Final interview + references



HOW TO APPLY:



Click the link

I’ll be in touch with you in 3-5 working days.



Please note, we ONLY accept applications through this application process. PLEASE DO NOT use the website’s message board as we don’t monitor this.

title: CRM Administrator
description:
Mia is an AI agent transforming communication at car dealerships by acting as a super-employee — handling phone calls, texts,
s, and more. We bridge the gap between modern customer expectations and dealerships' outdated communication systems. Our mission is to make the car buying and servicing experience frictionless, scalable, and genuinely helpful.

_________________________________________



Mia Labs is hiring a CRM Administrator for an initial 6-month independent contractor engagement. You’ll help us clean up CRM data, build reporting and workflows, and improve day-to-day adoption across teams.



Important: Since we primarily use HubSpot, you must commit to completing designated HubSpot Academy courses and earning certifications during the contract period.



What You’ll Do

*CRM Data Cleanup: Cross-reference internal spreadsheets and source systems to validate, standardize, and improve CRM data accuracy, so the CRM becomes the single source of truth.

*Lifecycle Visibility: Build clear visibility into the customer lifecycle (e.g., onboarding progress, renewals, cancellations in progress, key stages).

*Reporting & Dashboards: Convert existing spreadsheet-based reporting into HubSpot reports/dashboards. Some limited reporting may remain in spreadsheets as needed.

*Workflows & Automation: Design and implement workflows to increase efficiency. especially for the Customer Success team.

*Customer Health Score: Help develop and maintain a customer health scoring model to proactively identify and manage risk.

*Adoption & Enablement: Support documentation, onboarding, and change management to ensure teams consistently use the CRM.

*HubSpot Learning (Required): Complete assigned HubSpot Academy coursework and certifications.



Requirements (Non-Negotiable)

*2+ years of hands-on CRM administration experience (HubSpot, Salesforce, Microsoft Dynamics, Zoho, Pipedrive, or similar CRM systems)

*Strong CRM data management + reporting skills

*Experience maintaining a CRM as a system of record

*Comfortable working with Customer Success, Sales, and Ops

*Detail-oriented, organized, and process-driven

*Learn HubSpot and complete required HubSpot Academy certifications



Nice to Have

*Familiarity with HubSpot, and/or HubSpot Academy certifications

*Experience with CRM migrations and/or B2B SaaS data cleanup projects

*Strong knowledge on customer lifecycle operations and health scoring



Contract Details

*Type: Independent Contractor

*Term: 6 months (with potential extension based on performance and business needs)

*Schedule: Monday–Friday, 8:00 AM–5:00 PM US Central Time (CST/CDT)

*Hours: 40 hours/week

*Compensation: USD 1,000/month

*Payout: Bi-monthly



How to Apply: kindly follow the directions below, or your application will be considered.



Please use the subject title [First Name + Last Name: CRM Admin Vacancy], example: Jane Dole: CRM Admin Vacancy



- A short intro about your CRM background (which ones you’ve used), maximum 4 sentences.

- A link to your latest resume (ensure that the links are open to public viewing)

- A list of CRM-related certifications (if any)

Your main responsibility is to consistently follow up with clients who miss payments and collect outstanding balances throughout the month. You’ll act as our billing department and ensure accounts are brought back into good standing.

 • Prior credit repair experience (required)

title: Creative Director - E-commerce (Luxury Brand)
description:
Before anything else…



We can definitely tell when a message feels overly dependent on or fully generated by AI. Nothing wrong with using AI (we all do!), but if you really want to stand out, we’d love to hear your voice. Your taste. Your thinking. Your creative energy.



!! How to Apply (Read Carefully) !!

Incomplete applications won’t be reviewed. If you’re applying for a Creative Director role, attention to detail and the ability to follow direction is kind of the bare minimum.



1. Use “Creative Director” as your
 subject line.

2. In your message, include: A short introduction about yourself

3. A link to your resume and portfolio

4. Your availability to start

5. Your desired starting rate ($/hour)



JOB TITLE: Creative Director



Key Responsibilities:

- Lead the creative direction and execution of Cabana’s visual identity across all platforms

- Drive the design of products, packaging, campaigns, website visuals, and digital content

- Collaborate cross-functionally to tell one cohesive brand story

- Review, refine, and elevate all creative output to ensure luxury-level consistency

- Translate strategy into stunning visuals that capture the heart of our audience

- Inspire and guide the design team while staying hands-on when needed



Bonus: Step in as Brand Designer for key campaigns or special projects



Qualifications:

- 2–3+ years of experience in art direction, brand design, or creative leadership

- Strong portfolio showcasing visual identity work across digital and print

- Mastery of design systems, typography, color, and composition

- Experience in lifestyle, luxury, or wellness brands

- Detail-oriented, collaborative, and obsessed with visual storytelling

- Strong project management skills — able to run projects end-to-end and keep timelines tight



Bonus:

- Good sense for copywriting (you think visually and verbally)

- Proficiency in Figma, Framer, or similar tools



Why Work with Cabana?

- Work from anywhere that sparks your creativity

- Flexible schedule (just a few shared US hours for collaboration)

- Paid Philippine holidays

- Supportive, no-drama team

- Build a luxury wellness brand that blends science with style



Role Overview:

At Cabana, design isn’t just how we look, it’s who we are.



As our Creative Director, you’ll shape and elevate Cabana’s visual world across every touchpoint — from our website and campaigns to packaging and branded experiences. This role is about bringing beauty, intention, and storytelling into every pixel.



You’ll collaborate closely with our Brand Designer, Front-End, and Web teams to bring our luxury wellness vision to life. Every detail should feel thoughtful, modern, and unmistakably Cabana.



Perfect for someone who lives for aesthetics, thrives on creative energy, and knows how to turn a brand into a feeling.





About Cabana:

Cabana is where science meets style, a modern luxury wellness brand redefining what it means to look and feel your best. We offer science-backed treatments like GLP-1s and hormone therapies, helping people live with more confidence, energy, and ease.



We’re building something beautiful. At Cabana, you won’t just design visuals, you’ll help shape a world where wellness feels elevated, effortless, and deeply personal.

title: Lead Manager
description:
Cash Now Philly closes over 100 deals a year across Pennsylvania, New Jersey, Delaware, and Maryland. We're not a startup figuring things out — we're a proven operation looking for two Follow-Up Managers to join our acquisitions team.

This role is all about lead reactivation. You'll be working through our CRM database of homeowners, identifying motivation, and setting up quality conversations for our acquisition reps. If you're comfortable in high-volume phone environments and know how to turn a "not interested" into a real conversation, this could be a great fit.



What the job looks like day-to-day:

Working in a predictive dialer (Salesforce, Zen Call) making hundreds of calls per day

Reactivating aged leads and identifying homeowners who are actually motivated to sell

Handling objections and keeping conversations moving forward

Logging detailed notes and dispositions in the CRM

Handing off real opportunities to our acquisition team with solid context



Who we're looking for:

At least 2 years of cold calling or outbound sales experience

Clear English communication — you'll be talking to homeowners across the US

Someone who can sit in a dialer queue all day and stay sharp

You listen more than you talk and know how to find motivation without being pushy

Real estate experience is a plus but not required — we'll train the right person



What we offer:

$5/hour base pay

Full-time, Monday through Friday, 9 AM to 7 PM Eastern

Fully remote

Training from a team that actually closes deals

A tight ship without micromanagement — show up, do the work, get better every day



How to apply:

We take hiring seriously. Expect a questionnaire, an assessment, and an interview. Don't copy/paste some generic application — we read every one. Include the code word "reactivate" somewhere in your submission.

If you're ready to work with a real team that performs, apply now.

The Account Manager is crucial for ensuring customer satisfaction and retention by fostering strong relationships, understanding client needs, and facilitating effective communication between clients and internal teams. As an account manager, you are responsible for managing the relationships with clients. They must speak English fluently without an accent. Additionally, the candidate must be presentable, as this is a client-facing role, and should have a strong background working with American clients.

title: Programmer (agentic coding)
description:
Product Developer/Programmer (Agentic Coding) — Web + Mobile/PWA Funnel Builder (Founding/Contract-to-hire)



We’re building and iterating fast on a performance-focused marketing funnel + app experience. We use agentic coding (AI-assisted development) to move quickly, but we care equally about quality, maintainability, analytics correctness, and production reliability.



What you’ll work on (examples from our current stack)



- [Next.js](
) app-router product + funnel with localized routes (multi-language i18n).

- Onboarding + checkout flows (subscriptions/payments) and post-checkout success handling.

- Supabase: database migrations, RLS-aware data access patterns, server-side integrations, and edge/server functions.

- Stripe: revenue/trial reporting scripts, webhook-style flows, and subscription lifecycle handling.

- PostHog analytics: event taxonomy discipline, instrumentation, backfills, and data validation.

- PWA + push notifications: service worker changes, scheduling/cron-like workflows, and notification delivery reliability.



Responsibilities



- Ship end-to-end product features: from user flow design -> implementation -> QA -> analytics -> release.

- Use agentic coding effectively: create clear specs/prompts, iterate quickly, and verify outputs with tests + review.

- Maintain quality at speed:

- Write/extend tests for critical flows (auth/onboarding/checkout/notifications)

- Keep code structured, readable, and production-safe (no “AI spaghetti”).

- Own instrumentation: define events/properties carefully, ensure consistency, and prevent breaking reporting.

- Work across the full stack: frontend, backend routes, database migrations, and integrations.



Must-have experience



- Product-building track record: you’ve shipped real customer-facing funnels/apps and can talk through trade-offs.

- Strong TypeScript + modern React/Next.js experience (App Router preferred).

- Agentic coding proficiency:

- You’ve used tools like Cursor/Claude/ChatGPT/Copilot in real projects.

- You know how to validate AI-generated code (tests, diffs, edge cases, instrumentation checks).

- Supabase experience (Postgres, migrations, auth patterns; RLS awareness is a big plus).

- Payments integration experience (Stripe subscriptions strongly preferred).

- Analytics discipline (PostHog/Segment/GA): event naming, properties, debugging, and maintaining data integrity.



Nice-to-haves



- PWA/service worker experience and web push notification workflows.

- Familiarity with A/B testing, variants, and CRO iteration loops.

- Experience with cron/queued jobs patterns and reliability/observability.

- i18n/localization and multi-locale routing experience.



How we work (what we expect)



- Move fast, but verify: tests for core flows, careful rollout, and production-safe defaults.

- Strong product sense: you can propose improvements, not just implement tickets.

- Clear communication: short updates, crisp PRs, and pragmatic decision-making.



What success looks like (first 30–60 days)



- Ship multiple improvements to onboarding/checkout/funnel with clean, reviewable code.

- Tighten analytics (events/properties consistent, dashboards match reality, backfills when needed).

- Improve reliability of notifications/PWA behavior across environments.

- Establish a repeatable agentic coding workflow that increases speed without increasing bugs.



Interview / evaluation



- Short async screen (past work + how you use AI to ship).

- Paid practical task (small, real slice: [Next.js](
) + Supabase/Stripe/PostHog-style change).

- Working session (pairing on an actual backlog item).



Logistics



- Engagement: Contract or contract-to-hire (flexible).

- Time zone: Flexible overlap preferred.

- Compensation: Based on experience and availability.



How to apply



Send:



- 1–3 relevant links (repos, shipped products, case studies).

- A short note on how you use agentic coding in production (workflow + safeguards).

- Your experience with [Next.js](
) + Supabase + Stripe + analytics (even brief bullet points are fine).

- In the Subject line write “I KNOW AGENTIC CODING”

- Maintain quality at speed:

- Write/extend tests for critical flows (auth/onboarding/checkout/notifications)

- Keep code structured, readable, and production-safe (no “AI spaghetti”).

- Own instrumentation: define events/properties carefully, ensure consistency, and prevent breaking reporting.

- Work across the full stack: frontend, backend routes, database migrations, and integrations.



Must-have experience



- Product-building track record: you’ve shipped real customer-facing funnels/apps and can talk through trade-offs.

- Strong TypeScript + modern React/Next.js experience (App Router preferred).

- Agentic coding proficiency:

- You’ve used tools like Cursor/Claude/ChatGPT/Copilot in real projects.

- You know how to validate AI-generated code (tests, diffs, edge cases, instrumentation checks).

- Supabase experience (Postgres, migrations, auth patterns; RLS awareness is a big plus).

- Payments integration experience (Stripe subscriptions strongly preferred).

- Analytics discipline (PostHog/Segment/GA): event naming, properties, debugging, and maintaining data integrity.



Nice-to-haves



- PWA/service worker experience and web push notification workflows.

- Familiarity with A/B testing, variants, and CRO iteration loops.

- Experience with cron/queued jobs patterns and reliability/observability.

- i18n/localization and multi-locale routing experience.



How we work (what we expect)



- Move fast, but verify: tests for core flows, careful rollout, and production-safe defaults.

- Strong product sense: you can propose improvements, not just implement tickets.

- Clear communication: short updates, crisp PRs, and pragmatic decision-making.



What success looks like (first 30–60 days)



- Ship multiple improvements to onboarding/checkout/funnel with clean, reviewable code.

- Tighten analytics (events/properties consistent, dashboards match reality, backfills when needed).

- Improve reliability of notifications/PWA behavior across environments.

- Establish a repeatable agentic coding workflow that increases speed without increasing bugs.



Interview / evaluation



- Short async screen (past work + how you use AI to ship).

- Paid practical task (small, real slice: [Next.js](
) + Supabase/Stripe/PostHog-style change).

- Working session (pairing on an actual backlog item).



Logistics



- Engagement: Contract or contract-to-hire (flexible).

- Time zone: Flexible overlap preferred.

- Compensation: Based on experience and availability.



How to apply



Send:



- 1–3 relevant links (repos, shipped products, case studies).

- A short note on how you use agentic coding in production (workflow + safeguards).

- Your experience with [Next.js](
) + Supabase + Stripe + analytics (even brief bullet points are fine).

- In the Subject line write “I KNOW AGENTIC CODING”

title: Outbound Sales Specialist
description:
Outbound Sales Specialist (Cold Calling)



Molecular Biology Products Inc. (MBP)

Remote | Full-Time or Part-Time

Compensation: Base + Commission



About Molecular Biology Products Inc. (MBP)



Molecular Biology Products Inc. (MBP) is a rapidly growing North American supplier of molecular biology reagents and laboratory consumables serving leading academic, biotech, and pharmaceutical laboratories.



We help research teams reduce cost per experiment through strategic sourcing and high-quality alternatives to major scientific brands.



Role Overview



We are seeking a confident and results-driven Outbound Sales Specialist to conduct high-volume outbound cold calling to research laboratories across North America.



Your primary objective is to introduce MBP to laboratory decision-makers, communicate our cost-saving value proposition, and secure qualified discovery meetings for our scientific sales team.



This role is ideal for strong phone communicators who are persistent, target-motivated, and interested in building a career in B2B or scientific sales.



Key Responsibilities

Identify and engage decision-makers (lab managers, procurement, principal investigators)



Qualify opportunities and schedule meetings for Account Executives



Accurately log call activity and outcomes in CRM



Follow call frameworks and continuously improve messaging

Ideal Candidate Profile

Strong resilience and persistence in cold-calling environments



Excellent English communication skills (neutral or American accent preferred)



Organized, disciplined, and target-driven



Prior outbound sales, appointment setting, telesales, or cold-calling experience preferred



B2B, healthcare, or scientific sales exposure is an advantage



Compensation & Growth



Competitive base pay (based on experience and schedule)



Commission or bonuses per qualified meeting generated



Performance-based growth and earning potential



Clear pathway to Account Executive / Scientific Sales roles



Why Join MBP

Resume

title: Architectural Drafter
description:
Architectural Production

Revit / CAD | Commercial & Hospitality Projects

West Palm Beach, Florida





Our client is an established architectural firm in Boca Raton, Florida.



The Opportunity- Architectural Production

We are seeking a detail-oriented Architectural Production tea
mber. In this role, you will play a critical part in translating design intent into accurate, coordinated, and code-compliant technical drawings for a variety of commercial, hospitality, and mixed-use projects. Working closely with architects and consultants, you will support projects from Design Development through Construction Documents, contributing to both 2D documentation and 3D BIM modeling.

This position is ideal for someone who thrives in a production-focused environment, takes pride in precision, and understands how strong documentation supports great architecture.



Key Responsibilities

• Analyze building specifications, zoning requirements, codes, and site conditions

• Produce accurate technical drawings from architects’ sketches, redlines, and digital models

• Utilize Revit and AutoCAD to create coordinated drawing sets incorporating:

-Dimensions, calculations, and construction details

-Applicable building codes and standards

• Assist with BIM model development, including 3D models and limited renderings

• Coordinate architectural drawings with structural, mechanical, electrical, and plumbing consultants

• Prepare drawing sets for internal review, permitting, and construction

• Participate in quality control and coordination reviews

• Visit project sites as needed to verify dimensions and field conditions

• Stay current with evolving architectural technologies, standards, and best practices



Typical Deliverables

You will support the team with:

• Design Development (DD) Progress Sets

• Construction Document (CD) Sets

• Consultant coordination drawings

• Internal QA/QC reviews

• Permit and revision sets as required



Qualifications & Requirements

• Prior experience in architectural production or drafting (commercial experience preferred)

• Advanced proficiency in Revit and AutoCAD (Revit required)

• Strong understanding of building systems, construction methods, and codes

• Ability to apply fundamental company drawing standards to all drawing sets

• Excellent attention to detail and accuracy

• Strong organizational, time-management, and communication skills

title: Bookkeeper
description:
Join Our Remote Accounting Team!

We are a fast-growing, boutique outsourced accounting firm supporting high-growth e-commerce and service-based businesses. While our name remains confidential for now, we’ve been behind the scenes helping some of the most exciting DTC brands scale with confidence through expert bookkeeping, financial systems, and strategic insights.



We are a remote-first company with a collaborative, client-first culture — and we’re looking for exceptional talent to grow with us.



We’re seeking a detail-oriented, tech-savvy E-commerce Bookkeeper to manage financial records, process transactions, and generate critical reports to support client decision-making. You’ll play a key role in ensuring books are accurate, clean, and up-to-date — and bring clarity to fast-moving businesses.



What You’ll Be Doing

As our Bookkeeper, you’ll support multiple clients with day-to-day accounting operations, reconciling accounts, and managing both AP and AR functions.



Your Core Responsibilities:

- Record and categorize financial transactions using QuickBooks Online

- Reconcile bank, credit card, and merchant accounts

- Prepare and analyze financial reports (P&L, Balance Sheets, Cash Flow Statements)

- Perform invoicing, collections, and accounts receivable tracking

- Process bills and manage accounts payable workflows

- Process payroll and ensure timely tax remittances

- Track and maintain accurate inventory accounting records

- Communicate with clients via dedicated channels (Slack,
, Meetings)

- Support ad hoc bookkeeping and administrative needs as required



What You’ll Bring to the Table

**Experience & Skills:

- 3+ years of experience as a Bookkeeper

- Advanced QuickBooks Online skills are required

- Strong grasp of inventory tracking and accounting best practices

- Experience reconciling financial data across multiple platforms

- Experience with NetSuite is required

- Proficient with Google Workspace, Excel, and Word

- Experience working with e-commerce or service-based businesses is a plus

**Communication & Work Environment:

- Advanced English skills (written and spoken – C1 level preferred)

- Strong attention to detail and time management

- Clear communicator who can work independently and manage deadlines

- Tech-savvy and comfortable with remote collaboration tools



What’s In It For You?

- 100% Remote Work - Work from anywhere in the Philippines. No more long commutes or stressful traffic. Spend more quality time with your loved ones and thrive in the comfort of your own home.

- Long-Term Career Growth – With opportunities to scale into higher leadership roles.

Competitive Pay – $10/hr + benefits as an independent contractor

- Supportive Culture – Work alongside a leadership team that values transparency, innovation, and your ideas.

- Positive, People-First Vibes – We believe in balance, fun, and thriving together.

- Annual Performance Reviews – Your growth gets recognized and rewarded.



Ready to Keep the Books Clean & Clients Confident?

If you’re obsessed with accuracy, enjoy structure, and love bringing order to financial chaos — this role is for you. Join our growing team of professionals who value excellence, clarity, and results.

 might be the perfect next step for you.

description:

Job Title: Real Estate Research & Data Analyst (Virtual Assistant)

Type: Full-Time, Long-Term

Hours: 40 hrs/week (EST)

Location: Remote

Start Date: Immediate (within 7 days)



About the Role



We are a U.S.-based real estate investment company actively acquiring off-market properties. We are looking for a Data Research Specialist to support our acquisitions team by cleaning, organizing, and preparing property data.



This is not a cold calling, marketing, or underwriting role. You will be working with data only — following instructions to identify qualified leads, maintain clean records, and provide accurate updates inside our systems.



If you’re detail-oriented, comfortable with large datasets, and confident in Excel and CRM work, this is a great long-term role for you.

? Organize and clean property records inside our CRM (REISift)

? Flag qualified leads for the acquisitions team according to instructions

Must-Have Skills



? 2+ years working in real estate data research, list management, or related role

? Strong working knowledge of Zillow, MLS, REISift, PropStream, and PropWire

? Advanced Excel/Google Sheets skills (downloading, uploading, cleaning datasets, using formulas)

? Experience with PDF-to-Excel conversion tools (Tabula or similar)

? Detail-oriented and consistent — accuracy in data cleaning is critical

? Reliable computer and high-speed internet setup for daily full-time work

? Good written English for reporting and notes



Bonus Points



? Experience supporting U.S. real estate investment teams

? Familiarity with skip tracing workflows

? CRM experience (REISift preferred)

? Ability to handle large data sets without errors



Why Work With Us

This role blends administrative support with digital execution, creative tasks, research, and forward-thinking problem-solving. The ideal candidate is organized, curious, comfortable with modern tools (including AI), and able to operate with minimal hand-holding after a reasonable training period.

Support will always be available to ensure mutual success.

This is not a purely reactive task role; we’re looking for someone who can think ahead, suggest improvements, and help simplify how work gets done.



Core Responsibilities

Proactive Support

• Aside from the items we know we need help with, provide ideas and recommendations based on your skillset and what the business could use help with.



Website & Digital Support

• Make updates and changes to a Squarespace website (small, simple website)

• Add and manage content  (pages, blog posts, images, basic formatting)

• Create simple website banners and imagery as needed



Graphic & Creative Support

• Create simple graphics for things like:

o LinkedIn posts

o Website imagery

o Podcast thumbnails 

• Work from brand direction and existing examples (not heavy design work)



AI & Productivity – we are not looking for expertise per se, but curiosity and the aptitude/drive to learn.

• Use AI tools to improve efficiency and speed (content drafts, summaries, ideas, workflows)

• Apply basic critical thinking when using AI (not just copy/paste)

• Rework prompts to achieve desired outcomes 

• Create a prompt library of successful and commonly used prompts 



Calendar & Admin Management

• Manage calendar and scheduling

• Coordinate meetings, provide event support, and help us focus on priorities

• Keep schedules clean, organized, and proactive

• Familiarity with Hubspot



LinkedIn & Light Growth Support

• Support LinkedIn publishing and organization

• Assist with light outbound sales activities (research, follow-ups, list prep)



Video, Podcast & Content Publishing

• Curiosity and willingness to help with basic video editing (AI tools are easy to learn and use)

• Assist with podcast workflows, including:

o Publishing to Spotify and podcast platforms

o Managing basic episode assets and descriptions



Writing & Communication

• Strong written English skills 

• Clear, professional, and concise communication



Bonus: Vacation Rental Growth & Optimization

When capacity allows, this role may also support growth initiatives for two vacation rental properties, including:

• Brainstorming and executing strategies to drive more traffic and bookings

• Supporting SEO / GEO (Generative Search Optimization) efforts for property listings and websites

• Helping improve listing descriptions, imagery positioning, and discoverability

• Researching platforms, keywords, and promotional ideas to increase occupancy

• Identifying creative ways to differentiate the properties and increase demand



Compensation Note for Rental Growth:

There is openness to discussing a commission or performance-based incentive tied to measurable increases in booked stays or revenue, based on mutually agreed goals and tracking.



Preferred Skills & Experience

• Strong experience working with Squarespace and Hubspot

• Proficiency with LinkedIn (platform knowledge, posting, basic engagement)

• Ability to create simple graphics (Canva, Figma, or similar tools)

• Comfort using AI tools to increase efficiency

• Excellent organizational and time-management skills

• Strong written English

• Ability to work independently and think critically

• Comfortable juggling multiple priorities

• Highly curious and motivated to learn new skills



Nice-to-Haves

• Basic video editing experience

• Podcast publishing experience

• Familiarity with outbound sales or event support

• Interest in marketing, growth, and modern tools

• Curiosity around SEO and demand generation



What Success Looks Like

• You make things easier 

• Calendars are clean, content is updated, and tasks move faster

• AI is used thoughtfully to save time and improve output

• Growth opportunities are identified and acted on proactively

• You operate like a trusted extension of the business, not just task support



Please send your resume to: 
 with cover letter explaining why you are the best candidate for this post.  We will reach out to shortlisted candidates with an invitation for an interview.  This is an urgent post. We will be shortlisting candidates within the week.



Thank you.

description:
ATTENTION: READ THIS ENTIRE POST CAREFULLY



HOW TO APPLY (Follow Carefully)

We value attention to detail. If you miss a step, your application will not be considered.

Send an
 to: 

Subject Line: You MUST put the word "ADOBO" in your
 subject line.

Resume & Cover Letter: Tell us why you’re the best fit for this role.

1-2 Minute Video: Introduce yourself and tell us about your biggest sales win or your toughest "save" on a cold call.



THE OPPORTUNITY

We are a high-performance Real Estate team, and we are looking for a world-class ISA / Cold Caller to dominate our outbound prospecting. We don’t just want a caller; we want a partner who takes pride in booking quality appointments and managing the pipeline like a pro.



WHY JOIN US?

Proven Systems: No guesswork. We provide clear lead statuses, defined core values, and all the business facts you need to succeed.

Elite Culture: We operate with integrity, service, and results. You aren't just a freelancer; you are a vital part of our growth.

The Result: Booking high-quality, "ready-to-list" appointments for our agents.

Are you ready to dominate the phones? Apply now!

title: Customer Support Specialist (Subscription Management) - 2 Positions Available
description:
Customer Support Specialist (Subscription Management) - 2 Positions Available



Compensation: $500 USD/month base + performance bonuses

Hours: 40 hours/week, full-time

Response Time: Maximum 10 minutes

Start: Immediate



---



ABOUT US



We're Creative Team, a performance-driven e-commerce operation scaling rapidly. We're building a dedicated customer support team that operates with the same speed and excellence as our creative operations.



---



THIS ROLE IS NOT FOR YOU IF:



- You have no experience with subscription management

- You cannot respond to customers within 10 minutes consistently

- You have unreliable internet or electricity

- You're looking for part-time work or a side gig

- You can't handle high-volume customer interactions daily



BUT IF YOU DO have direct experience managing subscriptions and customer support, and can deliver fast, professional service, keep reading.



---



WHO WE'RE LOOKING FOR



We're hiring 2 Customer Support Specialists to join our team.



You must have:

- Direct experience in customer support (subscription-based businesses preferred)

- Proven ability to manage subscriptions, cancellations, billing inquiries

- Track record of fast response times (under 10 minutes)

- Professional communication skills (written English must be excellent)

- Reliable setup: stable internet, electricity, professional workspace

- Ability to work independently and handle high volumes



As a Customer Support Specialist at Creative Team, you possess:

- Experience with subscription management platforms (Shopify, ReCharge, or similar)

- Strong problem-solving skills for billing and account issues

- Ability to de-escalate frustrated customers professionally

- Detail-oriented approach to tracking and resolving issues



As a Customer Support Specialist at Creative Team, you have these character traits:

- Customer-obsessed: You genuinely care about solving customer problems

- Fast responder: 10-minute response time is your standard, not your maximum

- Reliable: Professional setup, no excuses, consistent availability

- Long-term thinker: You want stability and growth, not gig hopping

- Clear communicator: You write professionally and get to the point quickly



---



YOUR RESPONSIBILITIES



Daily Execution:

- Respond to customer inquiries within 10 minutes maximum

- Manage subscription changes (upgrades, downgrades, cancellations, billing)

- Resolve customer issues efficiently and professionally

- Track all customer interactions and resolutions

- Handle refund requests, shipping inquiries, and account issues

- Escalate complex issues appropriately with clear documentation



Performance Standards:

- Maintain sub-10-minute average response time

- Achieve high customer satisfaction ratings

- Minimize refund/chargeback rates through excellent service

- Follow company policies and scripts while personalizing responses

- Proactively identify and report recurring customer issues



---



COMPENSATION



Base Salary: $500 USD/month (guaranteed)



Performance Bonuses for:

- Speed: Consistently maintain sub-10-minute response times

- Quality: High customer satisfaction scores and positive feedback

- Retention: Successfully retain customers who request cancellations

- Reliability: Perfect attendance, no missed shifts, professional communication



Strong performers earn significantly above base salary through bonuses.



---



WHAT WE PROVIDE



- Comprehensive training on our products, policies, and systems

- Clear scripts and frameworks for handling common scenarios

- Direct support from team lead for complex situations

- Regular feedback to help you improve and earn more

- Long-term stability with a growing team



---



WHAT WE NEED FROM YOU



- Honesty over everything - if you can't handle volume, tell us immediately

- Speed and professionalism - 10-minute response time is non-negotiable

- Reliability - professional setup means no "my internet broke" excuses

- Commitment - this is a long-term position (1+ years), not a short gig

- Growth mindset - learn our systems, improve continuously



---



HIRING PROCESS



1. Application Review - Screening questions and experience verification

2. Written Assessment - Test your response speed and communication quality

3. Interview - Discuss experience and ensure alignment on expectations

4. Final Offer - If you demonstrate speed, professionalism, and commitment



---



CORE VALUES



Include the number (1-7) in your application that resonates most:



1 - Results Obsessed

2 - Attention to Detail

3 - Accelerated Excellence

4 - Relentless Ownership

5 - Prepared to Win

6 - Collaborative Innovation

7 - Never Not Growing



---



TO APPLY



1. Brief answers:

   - Describe your experience with subscription management and customer support

   - What was your average response time in your previous/current customer support role?

   - What tools/platforms have you used for customer support and subscription management?

   - Why are you looking for a long-term customer support position?



2. Your timezone and available working hours (e.g., "GMT+8, available 9 AM - 6 PM Monday-Friday")



3. Confirm: "I have a professional setup with reliable internet and electricity, and I can consistently respond to customers within 10 minutes."



4. Your core value number (1-7)



---



We're building a world-class customer support team. If you're ready to commit long-term, deliver exceptional service at speed, and grow with a performance-driven team, apply now.



Position: Customer Support Specialist (2 positions)

Compensation: $500 base + performance bonuses

Hours: 40/week

Response Time: Maximum 10 minutes

Start: Immediate

title: Amazon Listing Specialist (Creation, Optimization, and Images)
description:
Amazon Listing Specialist (Creation, Optimization, and Images)



We are looking for an experienced Amazon listing specialist to join our team on a long-term basis. You will be responsible for creating and optimizing product listings on our Amazon store, covering both the copywriting and image/visual side. This is an ongoing role with consistent work, not a one-off project.



If you have hands-on experience inside Amazon Seller Central and can handle both listing copy and image creation, we would love to hear from you.





What You Will Be Doing



Listing Creation and Management

- Create and maintain product listings in Amazon Seller Central including titles, bullet points, descriptions, images, and keywords

- Ensure accurate categorization, attributes, variations (color, size, bundle), and fulfillment routing

- Maintain compliance with Amazon listing guidelines and platform policies

- Monitor and resolve suppressed, inactive, or flagged listings



Listing Copy and SEO

- Write high-converting listing copy including titles, bullets, descriptions, and backend search terms

- Conduct deep keyword research for organic ranking using tools like Helium 10, Jungle Scout, or similar

- Harvest high-performing keywords from PPC campaigns and integrate them into organic listing strategy

- Manage ongoing listing SEO strategy

- Track and report on organic keyword ranking performance



Images and A+ Content

- Create high-converting Amazon image sets including main images, infographics, callout images, lifestyle edits, and clean layouts

- Use AI image generation tools to create lifestyle and scene images from white background product photos

- Build and update A+ Content with strong visual design and persuasive copy

- Publish images, A+ Content, and Store updates directly inside Amazon Seller Central

- Manage A+ Content strategy and execution on an ongoing basis





What We Are Looking For



- Hands-on experience publishing and managing content inside Amazon Seller Central (this is essential, not negotiable)

- Strong understanding of Amazon listing SEO and how the A9/COSMO algorithm affects ranking

- Experience creating Amazon listing images (infographics, lifestyle, callouts) — not just uploading, but actually designing them

- Experience using AI image generation tools to create lifestyle and scene images from plain white background product photos

- Experience building A+ Content that looks professional and converts

- Good written English, particularly for product listing copy

- Able to work independently, manage your own time, and meet deadlines without being chased

- Attention to detail — Amazon listings need to be accurate and compliant



Tools You Should Be Comfortable With

- Amazon Seller Central

- Keyword research tools (Helium 10, Jungle Scout, or similar)

- AI image generation tools (Midjourney, Adobe Firefly, or similar)

- Google Sheets or Excel for tracking and reporting

- Canva, Photoshop, or similar design tools for image and A+ Content creation





Schedule and Compensation



- Pay is $6.50 USD per hour

- We have a backlog of listings that need to be created and optimized, so this role will start as full-time work. Once the backlog is cleared, hours will reduce to part-time. However, the business is growing and as we add new products the workload will increase back to full-time. We are looking for someone who is happy with this arrangement and wants to grow with us long-term.

- We need someone who can be available during UK business hours for communication, but we are flexible on exact schedule





How to Apply



To be considered, please include the following in your application. Applications without these will not be reviewed.



1. A brief summary of your Amazon experience — how long you have been working with Amazon listings, and what types of products or stores you have worked on

2. At least 2 A+ Content examples you have created — screenshots or live links

3. 3 to 5 Amazon listing image examples you have created (infographics or callout images preferred)

4. At least 1 example of an AI-generated lifestyle or scene image you have created from a white background product photo

5. Your availability in hours per week



We are looking for someone reliable, skilled, and proactive. If you take pride in creating listings that actually rank and convert, we want to talk to you.

title: Technical Project Manager
description:
We’re hiring a hands-on Technical Project Manager to oversee the development of our mobile application and web application. You will manage 2 developers based in Myanmar, translate business requirements into clear technical tasks, keep delivery on schedule, and ensure the product meets performance standards (including latency improvements).



Key Responsibilities



Own end-to-end delivery of the mobile app and supporting web application (planning ? build ? testing ? launch).



Manage and coordinate 2 Myanmar-based developers: task assignment, timelines, follow-ups, and quality checks.



Turn app requirements into clear user stories, acceptance criteria, and technical tickets.



Validate deliverables against requirements and actively close gaps before release.



Drive performance improvements (reduce loading
), identify bottlenecks, and propose solutions.



Run weekly sprint planning, daily check-ins (as needed), and progress reporting to stakeholders.



Ensure proper QA process: test cases, bug tracking, regression testing, and release readiness.



Maintain documentation: requirements, change logs, technical notes, and release notes.



Coordinate handover, deployment support, and post-launch monitoring.



Requirements (Must-have)



2–5+ years experience in technical project management / product delivery for mobile apps and web apps.



Able to understand code and architecture well enough to review developer work, challenge estimates, and spot risks.



Experience managing remote developers (cross-country, async communication).



Strong knowledge of web development (e.g., APIs, databases, hosting, performance basics).



Comfortable with tools like Jira/Trello/ClickUp, GitHub/GitLab, and documentation workflows.



Strong English communication; able to keep everyone aligned and accountable.



Good to have



Experience improving app performance: caching, API optimization, DB query optimization, CDN usage, image optimization.



Familiarity with mobile frameworks (Flutter / React Native / native iOS/Android) and modern web stacks.



Experience working with Myanmar/SEA teams and managing time zone + culture differences.



Basic UI/UX sense to flag obvious user experience issues.



WA

title: Full Stack Web Developer
description:
Role Overview

We are seeking a talented and versatile Full Stack Web Developer to join our team. This role will focus on building and maintaining high-performance WordPress websites, with a strong emphasis on page builders such as Gutenberg, Beaver Builder, and Elementor. You’ll collaborate closely with our SEO and design teams to implement clean, fast-loading, SEO-optimized websites that serve the real estate investor community.



Key Responsibilities

- Develop and maintain responsive WordPress websites using Gutenberg, Beaver Builder, and Elementor.

- Customize WordPress themes and plugins using PHP, CSS, and JavaScript.

- Collaborate with SEO and design teams to implement user-friendly, SEO-compliant features.

- Manage website hosting, domains, and back-end infrastructure using cPanel.

- Troubleshoot and debug site issues to ensure consistent performance and reliability.

- Maintain website security and perform regular updates and backups.



Qualifications

- Minimum of 3 years of proven experience as a Full Stack Web Developer.

- Strong proficiency in PHP, CSS, and JavaScript.

- Hands-on experience with WordPress development, particularly Gutenberg.

- Ability to customize themes and plugins without bloating the codebase.

- Familiarity with SEO best practices in web development.

- Experience working with PostgreSQL.



Tools Required

- WordPress

- cPanel

- Beaver Builder

title: Operations- Focused Executive Assistant  (Property and Systems) (Irish Timezone)
description:
We are a growing property and business operation looking for a proactive, systems-minded Executive Assistant to help streamline and scale operations.

This is not a basic admin role. ***Do not apply if you do not have operation management experience and/or the ability to organise systems independently, use initiative and make decisions without constant supervision. Applicants must have experience managing active tenant/occupant communications and rental listings, not just internal systems.



You will be expected to think, structure, document, and execute with minimal supervision.



WHAT YOU WILL BE DOING 

In your first 30 days, you will:

* Audit and organise Google Drive structure across multiple brands

* Eliminate duplication and standardise folder systems

* Build a centralised SOP library

* Create and maintain a Master Systems & Access Register

* Migrate passwords into a secure password manager

* Develop clear communication templates

* Provide weekly operational summary reports



WHAT WE ARE LOOKING FOR

You must:

* Have experience building SOPs and workflows

* Be confident making operational decisions without constant supervision

* Have strong written English

* Be structured and organised

* Think in systems, not tasks

* Propose solutions instead of asking basic questions

* Property management experience

Bonus if you have:

* Experience with password managers

* Experience with Notion, ClickUp, Airtable, etc.



IMPORTANT

This role requires initiative.

If you prefer being given step-by-step instructions for every task, this role is not for you.



This role also includes active management of rental operations, including:

* Managing ongoing tenant communication and relationships

* Handling room enquiries and application follow-ups

* Advertising vacant rooms across relevant portals

* Coordinating viewings and appointments

* Managing application tracking and referencing

* Monitoring occupancy levels and reducing vacancy gaps

* Following up with contractors for maintenance updates

* Ensuring smooth tenant onboarding and offboarding

This is not purely backend systems work — you will be directly involved in day-to-day rental operations.



To apply:

Start your message with the word STREAMLINE and answer the following:

Scenario:

You join our business and find 100+ messy Google Drive folders, duplicated templates across properties, and login credentials stored in a spreadsheet.

What would your first 7 days look like?

How would you structure the Drive?

How would you secure login access properly?

Responses must be structured in bullet format.



HOURS & RATE

5-10 hours per week

depending on experience and capability

30-day paid trial period

title: YouTube Video Editor (Advanced, Full-Time, Remote)
description:
We are looking for an advanced full-time YouTube Video Editor based in the Philippines to join our remote content team.

You will work on a fast-growing YouTube channel with 45K+ subscribers and a 16K+ member community. Our content focuses on AI tools, vibe coding, AI agents, automation, AI websites, and AI apps.



Our YouTube channel: 
 

Our Skool community: 
 



About the Content

Our videos are primarily explainer-style tutorials, featuring head-talking demonstrations of AI tools. Each video typically includes:

-Camera footage of the creator

-Screen recordings showing tools in action

-Animations and visual explanations/effects



Examples of topics include using tools like Claude Code, Google AI Studio, and building AI-powered websites and apps.

Videos are typically:

-8–12 minutes final length

-20–30 minutes raw footage



Because we use a teleprompter, the raw footage is already very clean and requires minimal cutting. 



Team Structure

You will join a small remote team of 5–10 people, including:

-Scriptwriters

-Content creator

-Editors

-Thumbnail designers

-Project managers



Workflow (Time Zone Optimized)

Our production process is designed around global time zones:

India/pakistan – Scriptwriter writes the script

Europe – Script is reviewed and recorded by the creator

the Philippines (your role) – You edit the video once the footage is uploaded



The whole idea is that we use the different timezones as a benefit. All the recording files are probably inside the content drive  around 3am (Philippines time), then when your day starts around 6/7/8am you can start working for 8/9 hours on the video. After that period our project manager is probably just woke up and can check the full video. And is it ready for publishing.



When the creator uploads the files (camera + screen recordings), your workday begins.

You will have roughly 8–9 hours to edit the video, including:

-Cutting mistakes

-Matching camera footage with screen recordings

-Adding animations and vfx (we have ai tools for creating animations, feel free to check out our existing content also).



This workflow allows us to publish videos faster by working across time zones.



Tools We Use

-Premiere Pro / Final Cut / After Effects (or similar)



-Remotion (we have a paid plan)

-Higgsfield Vibe Motion (we have a paid plan)



If you can create custom animations & vfx thats a big plus.



What We’re Looking For

-Experienced YouTube video editor

-Strong sense of pacing and storytelling

-Comfortable editing tutorial/explainer content

-Ability to work independently and meet deadlines

-Ability to get a full video done in 8/9 hours 

-Work full-time for our company 

-4/5 videos a week



What We Offer

-Salary between $1,500 – $2,000/month depending on experience and quality

-Fully remote position – work from anywhere in South America

-Full-time, long-term role (we are looking for someone to grow with the team)

-Consistent workload – steady flow of videos every week

-Work with a fast-growing YouTube channel (45K+ subscribers) and 16K+ community

-Opportunity to work with cutting-edge AI tools and content

-A small, focused remote team with clear workflows and communication

-Creative freedom to contribute ideas for editing style and animations

-Opportunity to grow into a senior editor role as the channel expands

-Access to modern editing tools and AI workflows



How to Apply

If you’re interested, please apply with:

1.Your portfolio or YouTube videos you’ve edited

2.The editing software you use

3.Your location 



To help us evaluate your editing style, please also complete a small trial task:

Edit the intro of one of our YouTube videos (we will provide the raw files). This allows us to evaluate your pacing, storytelling, and editing quality:



Please also confirm that you are comfortable editing a full 8–12 minute video within an 8–9 hour editing window, as this is part of our daily workflow. We make it way easier for you to give access to tools like higgsfield & remotion for animations.

title: Operations & Design Manager
description:
I’m looking for a right-hand person to help run the day-to-day operations of a creative, detail-driven business rooted in legacy, storytelling, and exceptional client experience. The Album Concierge partners with photographers to manage, design, and fulfill wedding albums & wall art for their clients.



This is not a virtual assistant role. This is for someone who enjoys being hands on in the day-to-day and can see the bigger picture…someone who enjoys bringing order to creative chaos and wants to help move meaningful work forward.



You’ll work closely with me to:

- Manage album & wall art projects from start to finish

- Track leads, follow-ups, and project momentum

- Assign and manage designs, revisions, and approvals

- Step into album design and revisions as needed

- Keep projects organized, timelines clear, and communication flowing

- Notice gaps or bottlenecks and proactively suggest solutions

- Help categorize income and support basic operational tracking



This role is a great fit if you:

- Have experience in photography, design, or a creative service-based business

- Have a strong eye for aesthetics and detail

- Are organized, proactive, and comfortable problem-solving independently

- Enjoy real-time collaboration and communication

- Are available during 9a-2p EST weekday business hours (at least part of the day)

- Like taking ownership, not just checking off tasks



Role details:

- Part-time (8–12 hours/week) with room to grow to ~20 hours/week

- Hourly or monthly retainer (based on experience)

- Long-term growth opportunity for the right person

- Can be fully remote

title: Virtual PMO Project Engineer & Mobilisation Coordinator – Civil/Structural (Construction, Mining & Energy)
description:
JOB DESCRIPTION:

We are seeking a highly organised and technically skilled Virtual PMO Project Engineer / Project Administrator / Mobilisation Coordinator with a strong civil and structural engineering background and working knowledge of mechanical systems. The ideal candidate will have hands-on experience supporting projects across the construction, mining, and energy sectors.

Key Responsibilities:

PMO & Project Engineering:

 ? Support the Project Management Office (PMO) in maintaining project controls, reporting, and governance frameworks

 ? Develop and maintain project schedules, Gantt charts, and critical path analysis using tools such as MS Project, Primavera P6, or similar

 ? Track project milestones, deliverables, budgets, and KPIs, escalating risks and issues as required

 ? Prepare and review engineering documentation including scope of works, technical specifications, method statements, and ITPs (Inspection & Test Plans)

 ? Assist with cost estimation, quantity take-offs, and bill of materials preparation for civil, structural, and mechanical works

 ? Support procurement activities including vendor assessments, RFQs, purchase orders, and expediting

 ? Coordinate with multidisciplinary engineering teams including civil, structural, mechanical, and electrical disciplines

 ? Prepare project status reports, dashboards, and executive summaries for senior stakeholders

Project Administration:

 ? Maintain and organise project document control systems, registers, and filing structures

 ? Manage project correspondence, meeting minutes, action trackers, and RFI/variation registers

 ? Administer project management platforms such as Aconex, Procore, SharePoint, or similar

 ? Support tender preparation, contract administration, and compliance documentation

 ? Track and manage project certifications, approvals, permits, and statutory requirements

 ? Coordinate with finance teams on progress claims, invoicing, and cost tracking

Mobilisation Coordination:

 ? Plan and coordinate site mobilisation and demobilisation activities for personnel, plant, and equipment

 ? Prepare mobilisation schedules, checklists, and logistics plans

 ? Coordinate workforce onboarding including site inductions, competency verification, medicals, and compliance documentation

 ? Liaise with HR, training, and HSE departments to ensure all mobilisation requirements are met prior to site deployment

 ? Manage travel, accommodation, and logistics arrangements for remote and FIFO site-based teams

 ? Maintain mobilisation trackers and workforce registers, ensuring real-time accuracy

 ? Support camp management and site establishment planning as required

 ? Coordinate with subcontractors and third-party providers on mobilisation deliverables and timelines

Required Qualifications & Experience:

 ? Bachelor’s degree in Civil Engineering, Structural Engineering, Construction Management, or a related field

 ? Minimum 5 years’ experience in project engineering, project administration, or mobilisation coordination roles

 ? Strong civil and structural engineering knowledge with a practical understanding of mechanical systems and equipment

 ? Demonstrated experience across at least two of the following sectors: construction, mining, oil & gas, energy, or heavy industrial

 ? Proficiency in MS Project, Primavera P6, or equivalent scheduling software

 ? Advanced skills in Microsoft Office Suite (Excel, Word, PowerPoint, Outlook)

 ? Experience with document control and project management platforms (Aconex, Procore, SharePoint, or similar)

 ? Familiarity with engineering standards and codes (Australian Standards, AISC, Eurocodes, or equivalent)

 ? Strong understanding of HSE requirements, site mobilisation protocols, and compliance frameworks

 ? Excellent written and verbal English communication skills

 ? Highly organised with exceptional attention to detail and ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously

 ? Self-motivated and capable of working independently in a remote/virtual environment

Preferred:

 ? Experience working on Australian, Middle Eastern, or Southeast Asian projects

 ? Familiarity with EPCM or EPC project delivery models

 ? Knowledge of CMMS systems (SAP, Pronto, MEX) for asset and maintenance integration

 ? Experience with Power BI, Tableau, or similar reporting and data visualisation tools

 ? Understanding of AS/NZS standards, RPEQ, or equivalent professional registration frameworks

 ? Experience with brownfield and greenfield project environments

 ? Working knowledge of AutoCAD, Revit, or Tekla for reviewing civil/structural drawings

 ? Familiarity with contract types (AS4000, AS4902, NEC, FIDIC)

This is a fully remote position. Candidates must have a reliable high-speed internet connection, a professional home office setup, and be available for meetings across Australian or international time zones as required.
