title: Virtual Receptionist VA (Remote) | Fast Hiring – 24-Hour Review
description:
Important: Our application process moves quickly. If you are selected to proceed to the next interview stages, you must be able to respond promptly. Candidates who do not respond in a timely manner may be passed over.



We are currently seeking a Remote Spa Receptionist to manage inbound calls and book spa appointments. This is a long-term, performance-based position. Calls are recorded and reviewed regularly. Continued placement in this role depends on accuracy, professionalism, booking success, reliable attendance, no missed calls during scheduled shifts, quick response times, and the ability to professionally manage complaints and de-escalate dissatisfied clients.



To apply: Please copy the questions below, paste them into your reply, and answer each question thoroughly.



(1) Location & Utilities: Where in the Philippines are you currently located? How often have you experienced power or internet outages in the past year? Do you have backup solutions (e.g., generator, mobile hotspot) to ensure your work is not affected?



(2) Home Setup: Will you be working from home? Is your workspace quiet and suitable for handling calls? Do you have your own computer or laptop? Please attach a screenshot of your current internet speed.



(3) Availability & Speed: Can you consistently work seven days a week, six hours per day, and remain available for the full shift without missed calls? How quickly do you typically answer inbound calls? What is your current typing speed in words per minute?



(4) Call & Complaint Experience: Describe your experience with answering inbound calls, booking or scheduling appointments, customer service, following scripts, and handling complaints. Provide one real example of how you de-escalated an upset client and the outcome.



(5) Tools & Systems: What programs, tools, phone systems, or VoIP platforms have you used for handling calls? Do you have any issues with background noise, power outages, or internet interruptions? How do you take notes and log client interactions during calls?



(6) Voice Recordings: Please submit two short voice recordings. Recording one should demonstrate booking an appointment from 7:00 PM to 8:00 PM with a total amount of $60. Recording two should demonstrate handling a double charge for a 90-minute massage where the client sees two $90 charges and is requesting a refund. Your tone should be calm, polite, and professional.



(7) Current Job: Do you currently have another job? If yes, where, how many hours per week, and what are your roles and tasks in that job?



(8) Schedule, Pay & Start Date: Are you able to work seven days a week, six hours per day, during Central Standard Time (CST) hours without conflicts? What is your expected hourly or monthly rate? What is your earliest physical start date if hired?



(9) Marketing, Design & Video: Do you have experience with online marketing, creating content using Canva, or producing short video clips such as
 Reels or similar platforms? Please describe your skills and provide samples of your previous work if available.



(10) Fit, Skills & Experience: Briefly introduce yourself and explain why you would be a good fit for this role. Include what you believe is most important when handling spa clients over the phone, especially during complaints, and what other skills or areas you have a lot of experience in.

title: We’re Hiring: Remote Customer Service Representative / Move Consultant – Apply NOW!
description:
We’re looking for a Remote CSR / Move Consultant who knows that sales starts with service. Someone who can build rapport instantly, listen carefully, guide customers with care, and confidently turn inquiries into booked moves.



If you love talking to people, building relationships, and closing with integrity — this role is for you.



Act fast! Only the first applicants who submit a resume, voice recording, and portfolio will be considered. Missing any of these? Your application won’t make it.



Role Overview



This is a remote, inbound sales-focused CSR position handling:

Warm inbound calls

Web quote requests

Referrals

Follow-ups



You will respond quickly, ask the right questions, educate customers, build trust, and close moves. Success means:



Lightning-fast response times

Strong follow-up discipline

Clean, detailed CRM notes

Consistent bookings

Customers feeling heard, valued, and confident



Tools you’ll use daily: SmartMoving CRM and Dialpad for calls and texting.





Key Responsibilities



1. Build Genuine Connection

Answer calls with warmth, professionalism, and empathy

Listen actively — understand each customer’s situation

Make every customer feel supported



2. Qualify & Guide the Move

Ask structured questions (dates, locations, stairs, elevators, specialty items, packing needs, etc.)

Identify concerns and stress points

Position our services as solutions, not just pricing



3. Quote, Close & Book

Provide accurate quotes or schedule estimates

Clearly explain services, policies, and booking process

Confidently secure bookings (date/time + deposit when appropriate)

Handle objections professionally



4. Follow-Up With Purpose

Run consistent follow-ups via call, text, and

Manage leads until every one is Booked or Lost

No lead left behind



5. CRM & Team Coordination

Maintain accurate notes and lead statuses

Create clear next-step tasks

Coordinate with Move Coordinators for smooth handoffs

Support schedule adjustments during high-volume periods

title: CUSTOMER SUPPORT REPRESENTATIVE (TEXT-BASED CLIENT ENGAGEMENT)
description:
JOB OVERVIEW



Application Requirements:



Include a custom video to Paul explaining why you are a good fit for this specific role and detailing your experience with client communication, expectation management, and written engagement (no generic or repurposed videos will be considered)



Submit resume



YOUR APPLICATION WILL NOT BE REVIEWED IF YOU DO NOT MEET THE APPLICATION REQUIREMENTS



We are seeking a part-time Customer Support Representative to manage live, text-based communication with clients. This role requires strong written communication skills, emotional intelligence, and the ability to professionally manage client expectations in real-time.



This is a 20-hour per week remote position requiring availability during identified live communication windows. You must be online and responsive during assigned hours, as this role involves live text interactions with clients.



Key Responsibilities:



Communicate directly with clients through a text-based system in real time



Prompt customers to complete surveys and follow up as needed



Use structured message templates while also crafting customized responses based on client situations (NO AI)



Manage client expectations professionally and proactively



De-escalate concerns and maintain positive client relationships



Draft authentic, human-written reviews for labor-based services (concrete, masonry, fencing, roofing) without using AI tools



Use Airtable and text software systems to track conversations and manage workflows



Collaborate with internal tea
mbers regarding client updates and status



Must-Haves:



Strong written English proficiency (this role is writing-heavy)



Professional, positive, and solution-oriented communication style



Ability to manage live text conversations while staying organized



Comfortable using Airtable and text communication software



Strong client management and expectation-setting skills



Ability to draft high-quality, natural reviews without AI assistance



Reliable availability during assigned live interaction hours



Self-disciplined and able to work independently



Nice-to-Haves (Not Required):



Experience in customer support for service-based businesses



Familiarity with construction or home service industries



Experience with CRM or workflow management systems



Basic project management experience



Compensation & Structure:



Part-time position (20 hours per week)



Defined live hours required for client interaction



Trial period to assess fit and communication quality



Payment via Wise



Opportunity for long-term growth and expanded responsibilities based on performance



Important Notice:



This role requires live engagement and active presence during scheduled hours. If you cannot consistently be available for real-time text communication, please do not apply.



This role requires authentic human writing. AI-generated writing samples will not be considered.



We value professionalism, emotional intelligence, and strong written clarity above all else.

title: E-Commerce Customer Service & Operations Assistant
description:
I'm looking for an E-Commerce Customer Service & Operations Assistant



Location: Remote 

Hours: Eastern Time Zone (US)

Rate: $3/hour



About Us 

We are an e-commerce brand focused on helping businesses generate more Google reviews through NFC-powered products. 



Position Overview

We’re looking for a Customer Service & Operations Assistant who will manage support tickets, monitor order fulfillment, handle chargebacks, and assist with social media and outreach efforts.

This role requires someone proactive, organized, and comfortable wearing multiple hats in a fast-paced e-commerce environment.



You will be responsible for keeping customer experience smooth and operations running cleanly behind the scenes.



Key Responsibilities

- Customer Support

- Respond to customer inquiries via
, chat, and social media 

- Handle refunds, replacements, defective claims, shipping follow-ups

- Ensure customers receive timely and professional responses



Order & Fulfillment Management

- Monitor tracking and resolve shipping delays



Chargeback Management

Social Media & Outreach

Process Improvement

Required Skills & Experience

You Are:

How to Apply

title: AI SEO GEO
description:
Bumpy is currently the fastest-growing dating app in the market, with over 20,000,000+ installs in just a few years. We are scaling even faster, and you have the chance to be part of this exciting journey.

Historically, international online dating has been plagued by hookup culture, language and cultural barriers, bots, and scams. Our mission is to change that. Regardless of skin color, language, or location, we aim to help people find their international soulmate easily and safely.



The Role

You'll be Bumpy's in-house content and search expert: writing high-quality pages and posts, ensuring everything ranks, and staying ahead of how AI-powered tools like Claude and Perplexity are changing content discovery. You know how to use AI to work faster without sacrificing quality — and you know exactly where the line is.



What You'll Do

- Write and optimize website content: landing pages, blog posts, feature pages, and campaign copy

- Own on-page SEO — keywords, metadata, internal linking, schema, and content audits

- Partner with engineering on technical SEO: crawlability, structured data, Core Web Vitals, site architecture

- Apply GEO/AEO principles so Bumpy's content gets cited and surfaced by LLMs and AI search tools

- Use AI writing tools to accelerate production while ensuring output meets editorial and E-E-A-T standards

- Track performance via Search Console, Ahrefs/Semrush, and GA4 — and act on what you find



What We're Looking For

- 3–6 years of content writing experience with proven organic growth results

- Strong command of both on-page and technical SEO

- Familiarity with LLM search behavior, GEO/AEO, and how AI systems surface web content

- Savvy, critical use of AI writing tools — you know when to use them and when to rewrite

- Excellent writing skills across formats, tones, and a global audience

- Bonus: experience in consumer tech or dating apps, multilingual SEO, or CRO



We also require an experience in a developing products from very beginning and til supporting your code in production with real customers.



Let’s Bump!

title: Furnished Rental Property Manager
description:
VIRTUAL ASSISTANT – SHORT-TERM & MID-TERM RENTALS



Summary

We are hiring a highly organized, proactive Virtual Assistant with direct experience in short-term rental (STR) and mid-term rental operations. This role supports guest communication, maintenance coordination, owner reporting, systems management, and operational optimization across multiple properties.



This is not an entry-level position. You must understand how STR operations actually run and be able to think critically without constant supervision.



Hours: 6–8 hours per day (flexible scheduling, ET timezone)

Compensation: Competitive hourly rate based on experience + performance bonuses for client acquisition and tenant placement





CORE RESPONSIBILITIES



Guest & Tenant Management:



* Manage guest/tenant communication across platforms (Airbnb, Furnished Finder, etc.)

* Handle screening, booking flow, move-in/move-out coordination

* Track issues, payments, and documentation

* Proactively anticipate guest needs with a hospitality-driven mindset



Maintenance & Operations:



* Coordinate cleaners, vendors, and maintenance teams

* Track and document work orders and resolutions

* Ensure properties are ready for upcoming stays

* Maintain organized operational systems



Owner & Client Communication:



* Provide performance updates and occupancy insights

* Assist with onboarding new properties

* Anticipate owner needs and escalate appropriately



Systems & Software:



* Work inside PMS tools (e.g., Hospitable, RentRedi, Monday, GHL, etc.)

* Maintain documentation and operational workflows

* Comfortable learning and implementing new AI tools

* Support listing optimization and platform management



Bookkeeping (Preferred, not required)



* Assist with rent collection, expense tracking, and reconciliations





REQUIRED EXPERIENCE



* Proven STR or property management experience

* Strong English communication (written and verbal)

* Ability to manage multiple priorities independently

* Strong critical thinking and decision-making ability

* High level of organization and accountability







HOT TO APPLY:



Submit:



1. Your resume

2. A self-recorded video answering the questions below



If you do not have experience for a particular question, skip it and continue.



Video Instructions:



* Record a single video.

* Do not read from a script.

* Structure your thinking.

* We are evaluating how you think, prioritize, and make decisions — not just your answers.

* Use real examples where possible.



Video Questions:



1. Start by summarizing your experience relevant to this role.

What types of properties have you managed, how many, and what systems or tools did you use? Share any other relevant details.



2. An owner texts:

“Revenue is down this month. We need to fix this.”

How do you respond and what do you review before replying?



3. A guest messages at 9:30 PM:

“The house is beautiful. We’re just a little cold.”

What does this likely mean, and what do you do immediately?



4. You are handling three issues at once:

* Cleaner running late on a same-day turnover

* Guest locked out

* Owner asking for urgent performance numbers

  How do you prioritize and why?



5. We tell you:

“Make sure the property is ready for the weekend.”

What questions do you ask before taking action?



6. A guest wants to book for 1 night and whether quiet hours are strictly enforced. How do you respond?



7. Occupancy is strong, but our pricing is lower than comparable properties nearby. What do you evaluate before adjusting pricing?



8. Guest response times increased from 5 minutes to 45 minutes over the past two weeks. No one has complained yet. What do you do?



9. Describe a system or workflow you built or improved in an property management operation. What was the problem and what changed after implementation?



10. When do you escalate an issue to an owner instead of solving it yourself? Provide an example.



11. What makes you stand out from other candidates applying for this role?



12. Do you have any questions for us?





We are looking for someone who can think ahead, read between the lines, and operate with ownership.



If you believe you fit that description, we look forward to reviewing your application.

title: Lead Generation Specialist (Outbound)
description:
Lead Generation Specialist (Outbound)



Starlight Marketing | Remote



Starlight Marketing is looking for a motivated and results-driven Lead Generation Specialist (Outbound) to help expand our outreach efforts and identify potential clients for our team.



This role focuses on initiating contact with prospects, introducing our services, and identifying qualified leads for further follow-up. You will not be responsible for closing sales — your primary goal is to generate interest and pass qualified prospects to the appropriate tea
mber.



What your day will look like:

? Recording call details and outcomes in the system

? Meeting daily or weekly outreach and lead targets



We’re looking for someone who:

? Is confident speaking with new people daily

? Has clear and professional English communication

? Can follow scripts while keeping conversations natural

? Is resilient and comfortable handling objections

? Is target-driven and self-motivated in a remote setup



Technical Requirements:

? Must have your own laptop or desktop computer

? Minimum 8GB RAM

? Stable internet connection with at least 30 Mbps speed

? Quiet work environment suitable for calls



Previous experience in outbound calling, lead generation, or sales is an advantage but not required. We value confidence, consistency, and willingness to learn.



This is a remote, long-term role with stable hours and growth opportunities as Starlight Marketing continues to expand.



If you’re motivated by targets and enjoy connecting with new people, we’d love to hear from you.

Started in 2017, and we're growing like crazy.

We expect to hire at least 4 salespeople, 3 admins, and 3 marketers in 2026.

Growing FAST - We sold 2663 lessons in 2025 and we're on pace to sell 3328 lessons in 2026

A small team of 1 American and 10 Filipinos.

We sell manual transmission driving lessons in the United States. Yes, really.

100% inbound leads from Organic Search (SEO). We don’t do cold calling.

No competition - in 90% of the markets we serve, we have no competitors. Because of this, our sale is pretty easy to make.





Compensation and Benefits

Competitive commission package - $3.50 per hour

Paid 5 Sick Days - Effective on day 1

Paid 10 days vacation - Prorated

Paid 14 Bank holidays - (Legal and religious Holidays are country-specific)

Paid Birthday Off - you pick a day off

Business Continuity Plan - In cases of calamity $40 hotel accommodations are permitted to ensure work will continue



Type of Employment

Full Time

40 hours per week

Schedule - 9 AM to 5 PM EST



Benefits to be provided after completion of 3 months:

Health Insurance

Office equipment, home office furniture, and anything else you need for work

Learning books, courses, training, or coaching that you want



Benefits to be provided after completion of one year:

Paid two weeks off for the Christmas Season



Entry Level Details

Note that this is an entry-level job. 

We do NOT expect you to have any prior sales experience. 

If you’re looking to switch careers and get your foot in the door, this could be great for you. 

This is a great opportunity for anyone with a background in any of the following areas: Customer Service, VA Admin, Admin Data Processing, Clerk,
 Communications, General VA, Admin Support, Sales and Admin Specialist, Administrative Support, Operations Admin, Executive Admin Assistant, Sales Assistant.





Duties and Responsibilities

New Orders - Processing Product Order (Gift Certificate)

New Orders - Initial Order Confirmation (Level 3)

Instructor Onboarding, Offboarding and Reonboarding

Reactivate Unavailable Instructor

Secret Message: When you apply, under the section that says "Is there anything else you'd like to write or include?", write the word PINK ELEPHANT. This will show us that you read the entire job description.

Duplicate Record Check

Updating the "Daily Tracking" Process

CTM Prospect Staging





Qualifications

At least 2-3 years of minimum work experience in a relevant or equivalent role

Comprehensive background in Customer and Administrative support

High level of accuracy and attention to detail

Excellent English communication and comprehension

Proficiency in using and managing Google applications - Gmail, Calendar, Documents, Drive

Preferably with knowledge in using cloud-based CRM 

Organized and has careful attention to detail

Ability to multitask, prioritize, and manage time effectively

Strong Problem-Solving skills

Customer Service Oriented and the ability to adapt/respond properly to different types of scenarios

Equipped with good skills in office/admin management, and can suggest process improvements

Must have your own computer, reliable high-speed internet, and a good quality headset and microphone.





What's Hard About This Job

Working Remotely - We're a remote-first company, and we never want to have an office. This is great if you like working by yourself in the quiet, but it can be terribly painful if you need the energy of coworkers nearby.

Our Cultural Values - We're an American company with an incredibly unusual culture. Even by American standards, our 7 cultural values are highly unusual. Our culture is challenging for people accustomed to corporate culture and especially difficult for people who grew up in Confucian cultures. It's a great culture for people who speak directly and have a great deal of self-confidence and ownership. If you identify as a misfit, you'll do well.

Multiple Software Systems - You're going to need to learn how to use 12 different software systems. This is great if you want to get exposed to and experience lots of technology, but it can be tough if you have a hard time learning technology. Secret Message - When you apply, you'll see a box that asks if you want to add anything else. Type in PINK ELEPHANT in all capital letters exactly as we've shown it here. 





Cheat Code for getting a job with us:

1) Our application comprises the majority of our recruiting process. Because of that, we suggest that you give us thoughtful responses and rich stories. We typically only interview applicants who give rich and detailed answers to our questions. If you write short responses so that you can hurry up and finish the application, you will not get interviewed. 

2) Tell us stories about how your actions match your beliefs and values. For example, if I say I value health and fitness, you don't know if I'm telling you the truth or if I'm just telling you what sounds good. But, if I tell you things I've done, I can illustrate my values of health and fitness with proof. For example, I go to the gym 4 days per week, I've done 6 triathlons, including an Ironman, and I can swim 3000 meters in one hour. My examples of things I've done prove that my actions match my values system. 

3) Be vulnerable and honest. We take very detailed notes during the interview process, and we conduct extensive background checks. If the stories you tell about yourself don't match what your references say, we will not hire you. We'd rather hire a C student who is honest about being a C student than someone who is a C student but tries to pass themselves off as an A student. Remember, this is an entry-level job. We're not looking for perfect. We're looking for an excellent cultural fit.

title: Executive Assistant – E-Commerce experienced
description:
Role Overview

title: Experienced Part/Full-Time Bookkeeper /Accountant (Remote)
description:
Experienced Part/Full-Time Bookkeeper /Accountant (Remote)



We are a fire & security contracting and engineering company looking for a part-time bookkeeper / staff accountant to keep our finances accurate, systems organized, and business operations running at peak performance.

This is not just a bookkeeping role — it’s an opportunity to grow into a leadership track in finance.



Key Responsibilities



Manage QuickBooks Online: create/send invoices, track payments, reconcile accounts.

Handle invoices, unpaid invoices, estimates, and job forms.

Upload invoices and track payments in Service Channel.

Review job completion forms to ensure accurate billing.

Keep books clean, always ready for CPA review and tax filing.

Organize and audit Google Drive files with proper naming standards.

Ensure paperwork and files are routed to the correct stakeholders.

Maintain a high level of order and organization - no exceptions.

Handle all insurance documents and tracking 





Requirements



Expert in QuickBooks Online (multi-entity experience preferred).

Proficient in Google Sheets/Excel (formulas, pivot tables, reporting).

Well-versed in Google Workspace (Docs, Drive, Gmail, Calendar).

Comfortable with Notion for documentation and task tracking.

Familiarity with Zoho CRM is highly preferred.

5+ years of bookkeeping/accounting experience.

Strong written and spoken English skills — must communicate with clarity and confidence.

Experienced in creating SOP

Can keep and maintain KPI's

Highly organized, detail-oriented, reliable, and proactive.

Independent worker with excellent problem-solving ability.

Experience with Service Channel is a plus.

Availability to respond during business hours (flexible schedule).





Position Details



Remote: work from anywhere

Part-time: 20 hours/week



Full-time: 40 hours/week

Must be available to work within 8AM-4PM ET, (must be reachable during business hours)





Growth & Career Path



We’re building for the long term, and the right candidate will have the opportunity to grow with us:



Potential to be regularized into full-time (40 hrs./week).

Promotion track: Head of Finance Department.

Be part of a fast-growing, tech-enabled contracting & engineering company.



This role is designed for someone who doesn’t just want “a job,” but a career path with real growth potential.



Application Instructions (Read Carefully)



*****To apply, you must complete all five steps below*****



1.) Write a short paragraph explaining why you are a good fit for this role.



2.) Answer this logic/comprehension question in 2–3 sentences:

 “If you are given 5 invoices to process, but 1 of them is missing supporting documents, what would you do?”



3.) Use this subject line in your application
:

 “Bookkeeper Application – [Your Name]”



4.) At the very end of your application, include this exact phrase:

 “I want to synergize with you”



5.) Submit a 2-minute video explaining your experience and expertise in bookkeeping, staff accounting, or financial controlling. (You may upload via Google Drive or Loom and share the link.)

title: Sales Support Specialist
description:

We operate at the intersection of technology, construction, and real estate. Our clients include owners, developers, general contractors, architects, engineers, and public entities working on some of the most complex projects in the built world.

Proficiency with CRM (Salesforce strongly preferred) and related systems.

Basic understanding of frequently used computer software and applications such as Microsoft SharePoint/TEAMS/365.

title: Short Term Property Appointment Setter
description:
We are a corporate housing/Airbnb Management company that has over 80 properties + across UK and looking to grow to 150 properties within the next 6 months.



We are seeking a highly motivated and articulate Appointment Setter to support our growing short-term rental and accommodation services division.



The primary purpose of this role is to conduct consistent outbound outreach to leads within our pipeline, qualify prospects, and convert cold leads into warm, sales-ready opportunities.



The ideal candidate must be highly proficient in spoken English, confident on the phone, and possess a strong understanding of short-term rental, serviced accommodation, and temporary housing requirements.



Key Responsibilities

Conduct daily outbound calls to cold and existing pipeline leads

Qualify prospects based on accommodation needs, timelines, budgets, and decision-making authority

Convert cold leads into warm, qualified appointments for the sales team

Book meetings between prospective clients and Business Development Managers

Follow up consistently with unresponsive or long-term leads

Maintain accurate CRM records and update lead status daily

Identify client requirements relating to short-term rental, decant accommodation, emergency housing, or corporate stays

Handle objections professionally and build rapport quickly

Meet and exceed individual KPIs and conversion targets

Collaborate with the sales team to improve outreach messaging and conversion strategies

Provide feedback on lead quality and pipeline performance

Key Performance Indicators (KPIs)

Minimum daily outbound call target

Number of meaningful conversations per day

Appointment booking rate

Cold-to-warm lead conversion rate

CRM accuracy and data completeness

Monthly qualified meetings target

Contribution to revenue pipeline value

Required Skills & Experience

Proven experience in appointment setting, telesales, or outbound lead generation

Excellent spoken and written English (mandatory)

Confident, clear, and professional telephone manner

Strong understanding of short-term rental, serviced accommodation, or housing sectors

Ability to quickly understand client accommodation requirements

Experience using CRM systems

Resilient, target-driven, and comfortable handling rejection

Strong time management and organisational skills



Desirable

Experience working with housing associations, councils, insurance providers, or corporate relocation clients

Knowledge of temporary accommodation procurement processes

Experience in B2B outreach

Background in property, lettings, or hospitality



Personal Attributes

Self-motivated and disciplined (especially if remote)

Persistent and results-oriented

Strong listening skills

Positive, professional attitude

Ability to work independently while contributing to team goals



What Success Looks Like

A consistently active and nurtured pipeline

High volume of quality appointments booked monthly

Clear conversion tracking from cold lead to sales opportunity

Strong client feedback on professionalism and communication



1. Resume in PDF format

2. Internet Speed test Result dated December 2024.

3. No less than TWO Professional Work References with name, your relationship with them, their
 address, and their mobile number.

4. Photo of your home office with your computer and all backups clearly visible.

5. 1 Minute Introductory Video



* Incomplete responses shall not be entertained. Applications not sent to the
 provided above will also be rejected*

title: Product Lister (Remote) | 20+ hours per week | Monday to Thursday
description:
Who we are

We are a fast-growing e-commerce company that takes its work seriously. We have clear processes, high standards, and a team that is expected to perform — not just show up. We are looking for people who treat their job as if the business depends on them. Because it does.



What you will do

- List 15 products per day within a set timeframe using our SOP

- Work according to a structured daily agenda (tasks are time-blocked)

- Maintain accuracy and consistency across all listings

- Communicate proactively when you encounter a problem or delay

- Follow our processes precisely — speed and quality both matter



What we expect from you

This is not a job for someone looking to work 1-2 hours and call it a day. A workday is a real workday.



- You follow our SOP without cutting corners

- You communicate clearly and on time — we do not chase our tea
mbers

- You take responsibility for your own output

- You respect the structure, the process, and your manager

- You are available and responsive during working hours

- You work with an agenda and understand why planning matters

- You are disciplined — not just at work, but in how you carry yourself in general



What we are looking for in a person

- You understand that simple tasks are not unimportant tasks

- You show up on time — actually a few minutes early, so you are ready to work at the start of your shift

- You are self-motivated and do not need to be reminded to do your job

- You are focused during working hours and do not let distractions get in the way

- You are open to feedback and act on it immediately

- You have a clean, professional workspace and presentable appearance during video calls



Requirements

- Fluent in English (written and spoken)

- Reliable internet connection and a proper working setup

- Previous experience in e-commerce or product listing is a plus, but not required

- Available Monday through Thursday, minimum 20 hours per week



This job is NOT for you if:

- You need constant supervision to complete your tasks

- You treat deadlines as suggestions

- You are looking for easy money with minimal effort

- You cannot handle direct feedback from management

- You think a simple task is below you — or not worth taking seriously



How to apply:

Send us a short video of maximum 2 minutes. We will not review any application without a video.



In the video we want to see:

- You — how you present yourself, how you speak, how you carry yourself

- Your workspace — show us where you work. It should be clean and professional

- Your answer to this question: "Why do you want this job, and what does professionalis
an to you?"



Additionally, send us a photo of your workspace 



Applications without the workspace photo and video will not be considered.

title: Sales Representative (Cold Caller – Hospitality / Real Estate Preferred)

title: AI-Powered Video Editor
description:
Video Editor with AI skills (Project-Based Pay)

Rate: $40 per short-form video batch | $70 per long-form video batch

(Estimated earnings: $10+ per hour for efficient editors)



We are looking for a forward-thinking Video Editor who specializes in leveraging AI tools to create high-performing marketing content. This role is focused on merging traditional editing skills with cutting-edge AI technology to produce short-form ads (TikTok, FB, IG) and VSLs.



Key Responsibilities:

-Voiceover Management: Generate and edit high-quality AI voiceovers that sound natural and persuasive.

-Ad Creative Production: Edit engaging short-form ads and VSLs using strong hooks and platform-specific pacing.

-Research & Content Selection: Identify the best AI-generated or sourced assets to fit the campaign niche.

-Creative Marketing Sense: Deep understanding of hooks, pacing, and how to make AI-generated content look authentic and engaging.

How to Apply:

-Introduction: A short self-introduction video

Note: Candidates who provide all three requirements will be prioritized.

title: Administrative Assistant – Sales & Client Support
description:
Administrative Assistant – Sales & Client Support



Position Summary



Administrative Assistant



The Administrative Assistant at Lawn Brothers plays a vital role in supporting daily business operations by managing inbound and outbound communications, coordinating schedules, processing invoices, and ensuring efficient administrative workflows. This position serves as the first point of contact for customers and helps maintain strong client relationships through professional, timely, and accurate communication.



Key Responsibilities



Inbound & Outbound Calls



Answer and manage incoming customer calls, inquiries, and service requests in a professional and friendly manner.

100 outbound calls a day 

Make outbound calls to schedule services, confirm appointments, follow up on estimates, and collect payments when necessary.



Address customer concerns and route calls to appropriate tea
mbers as needed.



Maintain accurate call logs and customer records.



Scheduling & Coordination



Schedule lawn care services, estimates, and follow-up appointments efficiently.



Update scheduling systems with changes, cancellations, and service notes.



Communicate daily schedules and adjustments to field staff.



Invoicing & Billing



Prepare and send invoices promptly and accurately.



Process payments and maintain billing records.



Follow up on outstanding invoices and manage accounts receivable.



Ensure customer accounts are updated with accurate billing information.



Administrative Support



Maintain organized digital and physical filing systems.



Enter and update customer information in CRM or company software.



Assist with reporting, data entry, and document preparation.



Support management with general office tasks and special projects.



Qualifications & Skills



Strong verbal and written communication skills.



Excellent phone etiquette and customer service skills.



Proficiency in scheduling and invoicing software.



High attention to detail and organizational skills.



Ability to multitask and prioritize in a fast-paced environment.



Professional, dependable, and team-oriented attitude.



ABOUT THE COMPANY



Our mission is to transform the lives of our employees and customers through building and maintaining dreams. Regardless of the size and complexity, we offer the best service possible when it comes to lawn maintenance, landscaping design, property renovations, pools, brick and stone construction, and masonry and concrete. We challenge ourselves to be great and the best version of ourselves through individual personal, professional, and financial goals and the impact we have in the landscaping space. Our core values are the backbone of our business and guide our hiring process: we are aligned, disciplined, results oriented, inspirational, impactful, and accountable. 



COMPETENCIES

Ability to identify and resolve problems in a timely manner; gather and analyze information skillfully; develop alternative solutions; work well in group problem-solving situations

Ability to adapt to changes in the work environment; manage competing demands; change approach or method to best fit the situation; able to deal with frequent change, delays, or unexpected events

Willingness to make decisions; exhibits sound and accurate judgment; supports and explains reasoning for decisions

Demonstrate persistence and overcome obstacles; measure self against standard of excellence.

Organization Skill to ensure all duties are performed in timely manner 

Communication skills 

Prioritize and plan work activities; use time efficiently; set goals and objectives; organize or schedule other people and their tasks.



Experience Requirements



Minimum 2 years of administrative, customer service, or office support experience preferred.



Experience handling high-volume inbound and outbound calls in a professional setting.



Prior experience with scheduling services



Experience with invoicing, billing, and accounts receivable processes preferred.



Proficiency using CRM systems, scheduling software, and Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, Outlook).



Experience in landscaping, home services, construction, or similar service-based industries is considered an advantage.



PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS

Prolonged periods sitting at a desk and working on a computer





COMMITMENT TO DIVERSITY



As an equal opportunity employer committed to meeting the needs of a multigenerational and multicultural workforce, Lawn Brothers Landscaping recognizes that a diverse staff, reflective of our community, is an integral and welcome part of a successful and ethical business. We hire local talent at all levels regardless of race, color, religion, age, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation or disability, and actively foster inclusion in all forms both within our company and across interactions with clients, candidates and partners.



If this position caught your eye, send us your resume! For best consideration, include the job title and source where you found this position in the subject line of your
 to

title: Job Title: Etsy Virtual Assistant - Product Sourcing & AI Images (Home & Decor)

title: Social Media Expert + Video Editor Expert
description:

description:

title: Video Editor
description:
WE ARE LOOKING FOR AN "A" PLAYER IF YOU CAN HANDLE FAST PACE LOT OF VOLUME AND READY TO GROW THIS IS FOR YOU



 About Detour Studios

Detour Studios is a young, fast-growing creative agency based in Montreal. We’re a fun, dynamic team working with a wide range of clients , from e-commerce brands and startups to gyms, restaurants, supplement companies, and more. No two days look the same, and that’s exactly what excites us. Our environment is flexible, fast-paced, and full of opportunities to grow.

Working closely with our videographers and creative team, you’ll help shape the final look, pacing, and storytelling of each piece of content.

What We’re Looking For

Solid understanding of short-form storytelling, rhythm, and social media formats

Why Join Detour?

Real opportunities to grow within a rapidly expanding agency

A fun, flexible, and collaborative work environment



Ready to take the Detour?

Apply now with your portfolio and CV

title: Credit Repair Specialist (Voice)
description:
Role Overview:

We are hiring a skilled Credit Repair Specialist to handle client onboarding, dispute processing, appointment setting, and ongoing account management. This role requires strong attention to detail, solid knowledge of credit repair laws and procedures, and consistent communication with clients. The position involves regular inbound and outbound phone calls, including consultation booking and follow-ups.



Core Responsibilities



Credit Repair & Account Management

• Support clients throughout the credit repair process by providing clear guidance and updates

• Complete client onboarding, including account setup, process explanation, and document verification

• Analyze credit reports to identify inaccurate, outdated, or unverifiable items

• Create, submit, and track dispute letters

• Manage dispute timelines and follow-ups

• Review bureau and creditor responses for accuracy and compliance

• Track client progress and dispute outcomes



Appointment Setting & Lead Management

• Contact new and existing leads via inbound and outbound calls, SMS, and follow-ups

• Qualify prospects and schedule credit repair consultations

• Confirm appointments and send reminders to reduce no-shows

• Re-engage cold or inactive leads to generate booked consultations

• Coordinate with sales/consultation team to ensure smooth handoff of booked appointments

• Track appointment metrics, attendance rates, and follow-up performance



Administrative & CRM

• Maintain complete and accurate records in CRM systems (Go High Level & CRC)

• Communicate with clients to request and confirm required documentation

• Assist with administrative and customer support tasks as needed



Required Qualifications



• 1–2 years of hands-on experience in credit repair

• Proven appointment setting experience within the credit repair industry (required)

• Strong understanding of credit reporting and dispute procedures

• Knowledge of credit laws and compliance (FCRA, FDCPA)

• Confident and professional phone and written communication skills

• Ability to manage multiple client accounts independently

• CRM experience (Go High Level preferred)

• Detail-oriented, dependable, and self-managed



Application Instructions:



To be considered, please submit:

• Your CV/Resume link

• A 1-minute video introduction

• Your family birth order (Eldest, Middle, or Youngest)

 Subject Format: Credit Repair Specialist – [Your Name]_[Birth Order]

?? Applications that do not follow instructions will not be reviewed.??

What kind of social media strategies have you worked with in conjunction with graphics and/or videos? If your answer is yes, then please send us the social media pages you worked with and the posts/strategies you worked with in concrete examples.

nt, we won't consider candidates without the above experiences.

title: Sales Person
description:
We are looking for a Sales Person who is experienced but at the same time willing to learn and listen to new sales techniques.



The company you’ll be representing is a well-established catering company based in Maryland, known for delivering exceptional culinary experiences and outstanding service. You’ll work closely with the CEO and will be trained by her on how to win deals.



Responsibilities:

++ Identify and pursue new sales opportunities through inbound leads, referrals, and outbound outreach

++ Build and maintain strong, long-term customer relationships

++ Prepare and deliver persuasive presentations and proposals

++ Bring potential customers through the sales process and close contracts to meet or exceed sales targets

++ Track and manage sales activity using CRM tools



Qualifications:

>> Proven experience in sales with a strong record of closing deals

>> Excellent communication, negotiation, and interpersonal skills

>> Positive, coachable attitude and a willingness to adopt new strategies

>> Highly organized, self-motivated, and goal-driven

>> Must be available to work Eastern Time (ET) hours



If you’re an experienced salesperson who’s open to learning new techniques and enjoys helping clients bring their events to life, we’d love to hear from you. Please include "Let's close the deal" in the subject line of your response.



Also, please answer the following questions:

1. What types of companies have you supported as a Sales Person?

2. Based on your answer in number 1, what were your responsibilities?

3. Please share an example of a time when you successfully closed a major deal.

4. For you, what is the hardest part of being a Sales Person?

5. How much is your hourly rate?

6. Can you commit in working ET hours?

title: Executive Project Manager
description:
Our client, a leading medical doctor in regenerative and functional medicine, is seeking a highly skilled Executive Project Manager to serve as the operational and strategic engine of the practice. This role is ideal for a seasoned project leader who excels at turning vision into actionable plans, managing cross-functional initiatives, and driving operational excellence in a fast-growing clinical environment.



Key Responsibilities:

Operational Leadership & Execution

Translate the doctor’s vision into clear project plans, priorities, and execution roadmaps.

Build, refine, and optimize SOPs, workflows, dashboards, and systems to support scalability and efficiency.



Project Management:

Lead and coordinate internal staff and external vendors to ensure cohesive execution.

Drive accountability by tracking deliverables, monitoring progress, and ensuring deadlines are consistently met.



Patient & Team Experience Optimization:

Ensure seamless, high-quality patient and staff experiences across all touchpoints.

Identify and proactively resolve operational bottlenecks and workflow issues.



Strategic Alignment:

Partner closely with the doctor to prioritize projects, structure timelines, and sequence initiatives.

Maintain organizational focus, alignment, and progress toward long-term goals.



Ideal Candidate:

Strong experience in executive project management, operations leadership, or project management.

Proven ability to manage complex projects and cross-functional teams.

Excellent strategic thinking, organizational skills, and execution discipline.

Systems-oriented, proactive, and skilled at building operational structure.

Thrives in dynamic, entrepreneurial, fast-paced environments.

Exceptional communication and leadership abilities.

***Preferably someone very interested in working in the medical industry. Not required but preferred



To Apply:



Use the subject line “Insanely good project manager” (required for consideration) and answer the following questions:

1. Describe your experience acting as an Executive Project Manager or operations lead. Share an example of a complex project you managed and how you ensured successful execution.

2. Describe a system, workflow, or SOP you created that improved operations.

3. Why do you believe you’re a strong fit for this Executive Project Manager role?

4. Are you okay with $5 hourly rate.

title: YouTube Educational Video Creator (On Camera)
description:
ABOUT THE ROLE



We produce short educational videos explaining U.S. business topics such as LLC basics, EIN steps, BOI rules, and state-specific guides.

This is a full-time, high-volume role focused on repeatable, script-based production.

You will present calmly on camera using scripts provided by our team and deliver fully edited, upload-ready videos.



MUST-HAVE REQUIREMENTS | NON-NEGOTIABLE

-Comfortable speaking on camera

-Clear neutral American-style English

-Ability to explain topics calmly and clearly

-MUST submit a 1-minute video sample



PRODUCTION VOLUME | READ CAREFULLY



We publish at scale. Strong performers typically produce 40–60 finished videos per month.

Each video means:

-Recording

-Basic editing

-Final upload-ready file



This role suits people comfortable with:

-High-volume repeatable production

-Structured script-led content

-Consistency over creative reinvention



RESPONSIBILITIES

-Record educational videos from scripts

-Basic editing | cuts | cleanup | simple visuals if needed

-Deliver upload-ready final files

-Maintain consistent audio video and presentation quality

-Re-record short sections when required

-Record simple voice-overs for short clips



REQUIREMENTS

-Clear spoken English with good pacing

-Confident natural camera presence

-Reliable microphone and basic lighting

-Basic video editing capability

-Ability to follow scripts closely



COMPENSATION | WORK STRUCTURE

-$800 per month

-Full-time | 40 hours per week availability

-Long-term contract for the right fit

-Performance judged on output consistency and quality



HOW TO APPLY



Record a 60–90 second video explaining:

-What is an EIN?



Upload video | Drive | YouTube | Loom

Share past work if available

Use subject line:

-Video Producer | Your Name | Earliest Start



Applications without a video sample will NOT be reviewed.

title: Freelancer Link Builder Wanted
description:
ABOUT THE ROLE



We’re looking for experienced link sellers / publisher relations specialists who already have access to real business, legal, finance, and editorial websites and can place links directly.



This is NOT an outreach-from-scratch role.



If you already control publisher relationships or maintain private publisher inventories, this role is a strong fit.



We are specifically interested in people who:

• Have worked at SEO agencies or link vendors

• Maintain private lists of real publishers

• Can sell placements at pre-agreed price ceilings

• Understand risk in YMYL niches (legal, business, finance)



WHAT WE’RE LOOKING FOR



You should already have access to:

• Business / legal / finance blogs

• Editorial websites with real traffic

• News-style or authority publications

• Guest post friendly publishers

• Clean websites (no spam history)



We are NOT interested in:

• PBNs

• Link farms

• Casino, adult, or crypto-heavy sites

• Auto-approve guest post networks



OUR PRICING (TRANSPARENT)



We buy links directly at fixed price ceilings:



DR 45–50 > up to $45

DR 50–55 > up to $55

DR 55–60 > up to $70

DR 60–65 > up to $90



Details:

• Permanent dofollow contextual links

• Minimum link life: 3 years



We prioritize:

• Repeat monthly buying

• Bulk orders

• Long-term partnerships



HOW THIS WORKS



You share your site list (URLs, DR, traffic, niche).



We select the sites we want.



Orders are placed directly.



Payment is made per placement.



No guessing. No wasted outreach.



HOW TO APPLY



Please send:

• A list of sites you can place links on (Google Sheet preferred)

• DR, traffic, niche, and your price per site

• Your preferred payment method



Subject line:

Link Inventory Partner – Your Name

title: Editorial Operations Manager – Manage Writers, Own Output (Not a Writer Role)
description:
==================================================

IMPORTANT – READ THIS FIRST

==================================================



We are NOT hiring writers. We are hiring ONE person who already manages writers and can fully own a content delivery pipeline.



If you are a writer, VA, or someone who plans to hire writers after joining, this role is NOT for you.





==================================================

ROLE SUMMARY

==================================================



You will own the delivery of high-quality, human-written, long-form content at scale. We already have a senior editor who reviews and approves quality. Your responsibility is delivery.



You will:

- Manage writers

- Ensure content is delivered on time

- Replace underperforming writers

- Hit monthly volume consistently



You own output. We do not micromanage.





==================================================

WHAT YOU WILL OWN

==================================================



- A team of 5+ writers (your responsibility, not ours)

- Writer onboarding and replacement

- Daily and weekly content delivery

- Meeting monthly word targets

- Ensuring content is NOT AI-generated or generic



You will NOT:

- Write articles yourself

- Ask us to hire writers

- Ask us to manage day-to-day tasks





==================================================

CONTENT TYPE

==================================================



- Long-form articles (1,500–3,000 words)

- Practical, experience-based content

- Pain-killer content that removes confusion

- Not fluff, definitions, or AI-style writing



We provide:

- Detailed outlines

- Editorial direction

- Feedback from a senior editor





==================================================

REQUIREMENTS (MANDATORY)

==================================================



You MUST meet ALL of the following:

- Currently or previously managed at least 5 writers

- Delivered 200,000+ words per month before

- Understand how to enforce quality at scale

- Can replace writers quickly if quality drops

- Comfortable owning delivery end-to-end

- Want a long-term role (6–12 months minimum)



If you cannot meet ALL of the above, do NOT apply.





==================================================

COMPENSATION

==================================================



- Fixed monthly pay (not per article or per word)

- Stable, long-term engagement



Compensation depends on demonstrated capacity and quality. You are expected to manage writer payments within your own structure.





==================================================

TRIAL / VALIDATION

==================================================



Before full onboarding:

- Short paid pilot

- Small batch of articles

- Quality reviewed by our editor



If quality and delivery are strong, we scale immediately.





==================================================

APPLICATION INSTRUCTIONS (IMPORTANT)

==================================================



To apply, reply with ALL of the following:



1. How many writers do you currently manage?

2. What niches have your teams written in?

3. Maximum monthly word volume you can reliably deliver

4. How you ensure writers do NOT use AI

5. One example of content your team produced (editor-approved)



Applications that do not answer ALL 5 questions will be rejected without response.





==================================================

FINAL NOTE

==================================================



This role is for someone who wants to OWN a system, not do tasks. If you are looking for stability, long-term work, and responsibility, this will be a good fit.

REQUIREMENTS (MANDATORY)

==================================================



You MUST meet ALL of the following:

- Currently or previously managed at least 5 writers

- Delivered 200,000+ words per month before

- Understand how to enforce quality at scale

- Can replace writers quickly if quality drops

- Comfortable owning delivery end-to-end

- Want a long-term role (6–12 months minimum)



If you cannot meet ALL of the above, do NOT apply.





==================================================

COMPENSATION

==================================================



- Fixed monthly pay (not per article or per word)

- Stable, long-term engagement



Compensation depends on demonstrated capacity and quality. You are expected to manage writer payments within your own structure.





==================================================

TRIAL / VALIDATION

==================================================



Before full onboarding:

- Short paid pilot

- Small batch of articles

- Quality reviewed by our editor



If quality and delivery are strong, we scale immediately.





==================================================

APPLICATION INSTRUCTIONS (IMPORTANT)

==================================================



To apply, reply with ALL of the following:



1. How many writers do you currently manage?

2. What niches have your teams written in?

3. Maximum monthly word volume you can reliably deliver

4. How you ensure writers do NOT use AI

5. One example of content your team produced (editor-approved)



Applications that do not answer ALL 5 questions will be rejected without response.





==================================================

FINAL NOTE

==================================================



This role is for someone who wants to OWN a system, not do tasks. If you are looking for stability, long-term work, and responsibility, this will be a good fit.

title: Link Inventory Partner (50–100 Links/Month | Non-Casino | Under $100 CPL)
description:
ABOUT THE ROLE



We are hiring experienced link inventory owners | publisher relations specialists who already control real publisher relationships and can place links directly.

This is NOT an outreach-from-scratch role.

This is NOT a VA training position.

If you already place 50–100 quality links per month using your own vetted publisher list this role is a strong fit.



WHO SHOULD APPLY



You should apply ONLY if you:

-Already manage your own publisher inventory

-Place links monthly at small–medium scale | 50–100 links per month

-Work exclusively with non-casino non-adult sites

-Maintain average total cost per quality link under $100

-Understand link risk in YMYL niches | legal | business | finance



IDEAL BACKGROUND



We strongly prefer candidates who:

-Worked at SEO agencies or link-building vendors

-Operate as independent link brokers or publisher managers

-Have long-term direct publisher relationships

-Control pricing | no reseller chains | no middlemen



REQUIRED SITE TYPES | YOU MUST ALREADY HAVE THESE



Your existing list should include:

-Business | legal | finance blogs

-Editorial websites with real traffic

-News-style or authority publications

-Guest-post-friendly sites with manual review

-Clean domains | no spam | no penalties



WE ARE NOT INTERESTED IN

-PBNs or expired-domain networks

-Link farms or auto-approve sites

-Casino | adult | CBD | crypto-heavy properties

-Mass outreach operators without owned relationships

-"We can try to find sites" applicants



PRICING LIMITS | STRICT



We buy links ONLY within these ceilings:

-DR 45–50 -> up to $45

-DR 50–55 -> up to $55

-DR 55–60 -> up to $70

-DR 60–65 -> up to $90



RULES

-Dofollow + contextual only

-Permanent placement

-Minimum link life | 3 years

-Blended average CPL must stay under $100



HOW THIS WORKS



You share your existing site list with:

-URL

-DR

-Traffic

-Niche

-Your price



We select approved sites

Orders placed in monthly batches

Payment made per live placement



No cold outreach

No guessing

No wasted time



WHAT WE PRIORITIZE

-Monthly repeat buying

-Bulk orders

-Long-term partnerships

-Predictable delivery

-Clean execution | anchors | relevance | footprint control



HOW TO APPLY



Send the following:

-A sample list of sites you already control | Google Sheet preferred

-Your realistic monthly volume capacity

-Your preferred payment method



Subject line:

-Link Inventory Partner | Your Name

title: Sponsorship Delivery Executive
description:
About Us: Event Strategies produces and owns a range of B2B event properties across a number of industry sectors in Ireland and the UK.



We specialise in planning and executing a wide range of events, from corporate conferences to social gatherings. As we continue to grow, we are seeking a talented and detail-oriented Sponsorship Delivery Executive to join our team and contribute to the success of our events.



Position Overview: As a Sponsorship Delivery Executive, you will play a pivotal role in managing and executing sponsorship packages for various events remotely. The ideal candidate will oversee sponsorship activation, maintain and strengthen client relationships, ensure brand compliance across event materials, track sponsorship deliverables, and oversee the creation of newsletters.



Important note: No second job. Full Irish office hours.



Key Responsibilities:



1. Sponsorship Activation:

• Develop and implement strategic plans to activate sponsorships across various marketing channels, maximizing sponsor visibility and audience engagement.

• Collaborate with internal teams to ensure sponsorship activation aligns with overall event goals and sponsor expectations.



2. Manage Client Relationships:

• Act as the main point of contact for sponsors, fostering strong, trust-based relationships through clear communication and mutual value creation.

• Conduct regular check-ins with sponsors to understand their needs, address concerns, and provide updates.

• Anticipate and proactively resolve any challenges during sponsorship agreements to ensure a smooth and positive experience.



3. Review and Sign Off on Event Materials:

• Review all event materials to ensure compliance with sponsor agreements and adherence to brand guidelines.

• Provide timely feedback and approvals, collaborating with teams to ensure sponsor branding is accurately and consistently represented.



4. Track Sponsorship Deliverables:

• Maintain a detailed tracking system to monitor the status of all sponsorship deliverables, ensuring timely and accurate fulfillment.

• Regularly update sponsors on the progress of deliverables and performance against key metrics.



5. Newsletter Creation:

• Work with the marketing team to craft compelling content and visuals for newsletters that resonate with sponsors and boost engagement.

• Analyze newsletter performance metrics and provide data-driven recommendations for continuous improvement.



Qualifications:

• Proven experience in business client success / customer service is essential.

• Exceptional written and verbal communication skills.

• Ability to thrive under pressure and meet tight deadlines.

• Strong organizational skills with a keen attention to detail.

• Collaborative team player with the ability to work effectively in a dynamic environment.

• Proactive, with a demonstrated ability to take initiative and see tasks through to completion.



Benefits:

• Opportunities for career growth and development.

• Friendly and collaborative work environment.

• Exciting and diverse range of events to work on.



How to Apply: Interested candidates are encouraged to submit their resume and a cover letter detailing their relevant experience to 
 and 
 include "Sponsorship Delivery Executive Application" in the subject line of your
. Applications will be reviewed on a rolling basis until the position is filled.



Event Strategies is an equal-opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.



We look forward to receiving your application and finding the right candidate to join our team and help us continue to deliver exceptional events!

title: Senior Operations Manager (Full-Time | Long-Term | Leadership Role)
description:
We are a fast-growing online coaching company helping high-level women build emotionally safe, healthy relationships.

We are a virtual team of 5 based in Europe and inthe Philippines. Our clients are based in the US, Europe, and Australia.

We are structured. We move fast. We value excellence.

We are looking for the person who will become the operational backbone of the company.



This is NOT an assistant role. This is NOT a task-taking role.

This is a leadership-level execution role.

You will act as the Integrator of the business — ensuring plans turn into execution, and execution turns into measurable results.



Your Mission

==============

You will own the internal performance and execution of the company.

Your success will be measured by:



- On-time launches

- Team task completion rate

- Accurate and consistent business metrics reporting

- Operational improvements implemented quarterly

- High client onboarding and retention standards

- CEO focus time protected



Core Responsibilities

==================

1) Business Metrics & Performance Ownership



- Own and maintain the executive business metrics dashboard

- Coordinate weekly and monthly reporting from all departments

- Analyze performance trends and identify bottlenecks

- Propose operational improvement strategies

- Implement agreed improvements with the team

- Ensure metrics translate into action

- You are comfortable with numbers and performance tracking.

- You do not avoid accountability conversations.



2) Task Deployment & Team Accountability

- Own the company-wide task management board (ClickUp/Asana/Notion)

- Convert strategic plans into step-by-step task roadmaps

- Assign tasks clearly and monitor execution daily

- Hold tea
mbers accountable to deadlines

- Follow up consistently and close loops

- Escalate issues early, not late

- You are not afraid to remind people.

- You do not hesitate to enforce standards.



2) Service Excellence & Client Delivery Oversight



- Ensure smooth and fast onboarding for high-ticket clients

- Coordinate with coaches to maintain delivery standards

- Monitor retention and client journey performance

- Identify operational gaps affecting client experience

- Improve internal systems to support premium delivery

- You are not coaching the clients (we have coaches for this) — you are ensuring operational excellence behind the scenes.



4) CEO Time Protection (10%)



- Manage CEO calendar strategically

- Protect focus time

- Prepare weekly performance summaries

- Anticipate needs before they arise



This is not a heavy admin role.

Your primary focus is operational leadership.



This Role Is For You If:

====================

You have 5+ years in operations or project management, preferably with team leadership expereince

Online coaching or digital business experience is highly preferred

You have managed remote projects or teams before

You take ownership without waiting to be told

Your natural language sounds like: 

“I’ll handle it.”

“This is the bottleneck.”

“Here’s the improvement suggestion.”

“This deadline will slip unless we adjust.”



This Role Is NOT For You If:

You avoid difficult conversations

You need constant supervision

You prefer flexible, unstructured days

You feel stressed by performance tracking

You are looking for a pure admin or assistant role



Details

========

Full-Time (40 hours/week)

Long-term position

Philippines daytime hours required with 3–4 hour overlap with EU time zone

Stable internet required

Leadership-level responsibility



Salary Range: $1,300–$1,500/month depending on experience

Performance-based increases after 6 months

title: IT Delivery & Program Coordinator
description:
IT Delivery & Program Coordinator

Department: Technology

Location: Remote

Employment Type: Full-Time

Job Summary

We are seeking a highly organized and execution-focused IT Delivery and Program Coordinator to support the reliable delivery of technology initiatives across our core platform.

This role is responsible for coordinating day-to-day execution across internal stakeholders and external development partners, ensuring work progresses smoothly from scope through build, QA, and release. The ideal candidate thrives in structured environments, follows through consistently, and proactively identifies and resolves blockers.

This is a delivery coordination role and does not include product strategy or technical architecture responsibilities.

 

Key Responsibilities

• Maintain and update project tracking tools, delivery boards, and milestone plans

• Monitor timelines, dependencies, and risks across active technology initiatives

• Follow up with internal teams and external vendors to ensure timely execution

• Coordinate QA cycles, testing schedules, and release readiness activities

• Organize and document delivery meetings, action items, and progress updates

• Ensure clear visibility into active workstreams and issue status

• Escalate risks and delays appropriately to leadership

• Maintain documentation of systems, ownership, and active initiatives

 

Qualifications

Required:

• 2 to 5 years of experience in project coordination, program support, IT operations, or related roles

• Strong organizational and time management skills

• Experience working with external vendors or technical teams

• Excellent written and verbal communication skills

• Ability to manage multiple workstreams simultaneously

• Strong attention to detail and follow-through

Preferred:

• Experience working in technology, SaaS, or platform-based environments

• Familiarity with project management tools such as Jira, Asana, Trello, or ClickUp

• Experience coordinating QA or release processes

• Basic understanding of the software development lifecycle

 

Skills and Competencies

• Proactive problem-solving

• Structured thinking and documentation discipline

• Comfort operating in evolving or ambiguous environments

• Strong stakeholder coordination skills

• Accountability and reliability

 

What Success Looks Like

• Clear and consistent visibility into delivery progress

• Reduced last-minute escalations and delivery surprises

 

Reporting Structure

This role reports to the Senior Director of Technology & AI Strategy and works closely with internal stakeholders and external development partners.

title: YouTube Shorts Video Editor (with After Effects)
description:
About 37 Projects

We are the #1 Video Podcast Marketing Service for Health & Performance Brands.

We help top experts, nutritionists, doctors, and wellness professionals grow their YouTube presence with engaging, high-quality content.

Now we’re hiring a YouTube Shorts Video Editor with advanced motion graphics skills to join our growing team.





Role Overview

We’re looking for an editor who specializes in fast-paced, high-retention YouTube Shorts and is highly skilled in After Effects motion graphics.

Your work must go beyond simple cutting—you must be able to enhance storytelling through kinetic typography, animated elements, transitions, and visually dynamic scenes.



You’ll be given raw footage and reference edits. Your job: replicate the style, elevate it, and deliver polished 9:16 vertical videos.



Key Responsibilities

- Edit 60–90 second YouTube Shorts using high-retention editing techniques.

- Create custom motion graphics in After Effects (this is a MUST).

- Design high-quality kinetic text, animated highlights, and visual callouts.

- Use smooth transitions, multilayer motion graphics, and dynamic visual pacing.

- Add sound design: music, subtle SFX, and emphasis pops.

- Apply accurate, engaging captions styled for high retention.

- Follow the editing style of our provided samples (Types C, D, E).

- Deliver export-ready 9:16 vertical videos optimized for YouTube Shorts.



Who You Are

- You’ve edited high-retention short-form content (YouTube Shorts, Reels, TikTok).

- You have advanced After Effects motion graphics skills—non-negotiable.

- You’re skilled in Premiere Pro (or DaVinci Resolve) and integrate AE seamlessly.

- You understand dynamic pacing and storytelling for vertical video.

- You can create clean, modern motion design that enhances clarity and emotion.

- Strong sense of design: timing, spacing, typography, colors, visual rhythm.

- Excellent sound design skills: enhancing beats, transitions, and emotional peaks.

- Attention to detail: no choppy cuts, no awkward pauses, no sloppy captions.

- Fast, reliable, and able to deliver consistent high-quality results.



Our 4 Core Principles at 37 Projects

Competence – Always improve, deliver your best, and think strategically.

Commitment – Meet deadlines, own your work, and deliver on time.

Character – Stay professional, solution-oriented, and trustworthy.

Communication – Respond quickly, give updates, and collaborate smoothly.



These principles are required for every tea
mber.

title: Educational Video Editor (Remote, Freelance)
description:
We’re 37 Projects, a YouTube agency specializing in long-form video content for educational, health, and wellness brands. We’re looking for a highly skilled long-form video editor who can transform raw educational content into engaging, visually dynamic, and well-structured videos that keep audiences watching.



What You’ll Do

- Edit educational long-form videos (10-30 min) with smooth flow & engaging pacing

- Cut filler words & awkward pauses while keeping the natural rhythm of speech

- Integrate animations, and motion graphics to enhance storytelling

- Add on-screen text, infographics, maps, and callouts to make complex topics easier to understand

- Sync and balance audio, background music, and voiceovers seamlessly

- Apply color correction & grading for a clean, high-end production look

- Collaborate with our team to refine and optimize editing style for engagement



What We’re Looking For

- Strong experience in editing educational, documentary-style, or explainer videos

- Advanced skills in Adobe Premiere Pro, After Effects, or DaVinci Resolve

- Ability to source and integrate high-quality graphics

- Excellent pacing, rhythm, and storytelling skills to keep audiences engaged

- Basic motion graphics & animation skills to add dynamic elements

- Attention to detail—edits should feel seamless and polished

- Bonus: Experience working with YouTube creators or educational brands



Check out examples of the style we’re aiming for:

- 

- 



About 37 Projects

description:
