- Developing detailed project plans, including milestones, budgets, and ownership.

- Monitoring progress and adjusting plans to ensure projects are delivered on time, within scope, and within budget.

- Holding stakeholders accountable for commitments and ensuring cross-departmental ownership.

- Facilitating effective communication across project teams and senior leadership.

- Identifying, managing, and mitigating project risks and issues.

- Producing regular project status reports, dashboards, and executive-level updates.

- Tracking project outcomes and ensuring benefits are realised in line with business goals.

- Collaborating with internal teams and external partners to ensure alignment and transparency.

- Managing multiple projects simultaneously in a fast-paced, changing environment.

 

Qualifications and Skills:



- Proven experience in project management across diverse industries.

- Strong understanding of all aspects of project delivery including planning, governance, stakeholder management, risk management, and benefits tracking.

- Skilled in creating visual dashboards, Gantt charts, and executive-level presentations.

- Highly organised with excellent attention to detail and ability to communicate clearly at all levels.

- Confident managing multiple priorities and navigating fast-moving environments.

- Experience working with cross-functional and remote teams.

- Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.

- A people-person with a collaborative approach who thrives in high-energy teams.

- Familiarity with budgeting and financial tracking.

title: Accounting Specialist (Contractor)
description:
Location: Remote (U.S.-Based Company)

Engagement Type: Independent Contractor



Position Overview

We are a U.S.-based media company seeking an experienced and highly organized Accounting

Specialist to support our finance operations. This contractor role is responsible for managing

accounts payable and receivable, maintaining accurate vendor and client records, and ensuring

sound accounting practices.



The ideal candidate is detail-oriented, comfortable working independently, and highly proficient

in QuickBooks Online and Excel/Google Sheets. This role plays a critical part in maintaining

accurate financial records, reconciling accounts, and supporting financial reporting processes.



Key Responsibilities

Accounts Receivable

? - Invoice clients accurately and in a timely manner

? - Monitor and match incoming payments

? - Research and resolve billing discrepancies

? - Communicate with clients regarding account status, charges, and outstanding balances

? - Send weekly collection notices for overdue accounts

? - Distribute monthly client statements



Accounts Payable

? - Review and verify invoices and statements

? - Determine proper account coding and accurately record transactions in the accounting system

? - Post accounts payable transactions to the general ledger

? - Maintain and manage the vendor master file

? - Process vendor payments (check, credit card, ACH/electronic transfer)

? - Communicate with vendors to resolve discrepancies and ensure timely payment processing



General Accounting Support

? - Prepare and adjust journal entries

? - Verify and post weekly credit card transactions

? - Reconcile accounts and identify discrepancies

? - Assist with monthly and year-end close activities

? - Support financial reporting and audit preparation

? - Participate in ongoing professional development to stay current with accounting standards and industry trends



Required Qualifications

? - Bachelor’s degree in Accounting, Finance, or related field (or equivalent experience)

? - 2–5 years of accounting or finance experience

? - Experience with U.S.-based accounting practices

? - Solid understanding of GAAP principles

? - Proficiency in QuickBooks Online

? - Strong working knowledge of Microsoft Excel and/or Google Sheets

? - Experience using various payment platforms

? - Excellent organizational skills and attention to detail

? - Strong communication and problem-solving abilities

? - Ability to work independently and manage multiple priorities



Preferred hours

Availability to align with US Mountain Standard Time

?

title: Graphic Designer – Full-Time (Remote)
description:
Graphic Designer – Full-Time (Remote) 

ABOUT INKERY



Inkery is a US-based promotional products company specializing in custom apparel, hats, and branded merchandise for organizations, schools, non-profits, and businesses of all kinds. We're a small, fast-moving team that takes pride in producing swag that actually means something — not generic giveaway junk. Our clients care about quality and design, and so do we.





THE ROLE



We're looking for a reliable, detail-obsessed graphic designer who can hit the ground running. You'll work directly with our team to produce print-ready artwork, social media content, and branded visuals for our clients and internal marketing. We move fast, give clear direction, and expect you to execute well without hand-holding.





WHAT YOU'LL BE DOING



- Taking regular images (JPG, PNG, low-res logos) and recreating them as clean, production-ready vector files — not just SVG, but properly formatted AI, EPS, PDF, and PSD files

- Preparing and formatting files for print production (correct bleeds, color modes, spot colors, vector output)

- Creating artwork for custom apparel, hats, and promotional products

- Designing social media graphics and digital content for Inkery's marketing

- Adapting and cleaning up client-supplied artwork for production use

- Turning around revisions quickly based on clear feedback

- Keeping files organized, properly named, and easy to hand off





REQUIREMENTS



- 3+ years of graphic design experience with a portfolio showing real print and apparel work

- Expert-level Adobe Suite — Illustrator, Photoshop, and InDesign are non-negotiable

- Proven ability to convert raster images to true vector format across AI, EPS, PDF, and PSD — this is a core part of the job

- Experience with embroidery, screen printing, or promotional product file prep is a strong plus

- Ability to design for social media (static posts, stories, branded templates)

- Stable, reliable internet connection — this is required, not optional

- Extreme attention to detail — wrong colors, missed bleeds, and sloppy file prep are not acceptable here





YOU'RE A GOOD FIT IF...



- You've done apparel or merchandise design and understand print production inside and out

- You know the difference between a true vector redraw and an embedded raster in a vector file

- You're comfortable working independently in a remote setting

- You communicate clearly and flag issues before they become problems

- You don't need to be micromanaged





YOU'RE NOT A GOOD FIT IF...



- You only have web or UI design experience

- Your vectorizing work is trace-and-submit without quality checking

- You need constant check-ins to stay on track

- Your Adobe skills are beginner or intermediate level

- Your internet is inconsistent or unreliable





WHAT WE OFFER



- $5/hr during training, increasing to $6/hr once independent

- Raises based on tenure and output — we reward people who perform and stick around

- Remote, work-from-home position

- Stable, long-term role with a growing US company

- Direct communication with the business owner

title: Online English/World History Teachers (Near-Native Accent)
description:
About Pomelo Academy

Pomelo Academy is an innovative online international school dedicated to delivering high-quality education to students worldwide. We provide a dynamic and engaging learning environment, catering to individualized instruction that transcends geographical boundaries.



Job Description

We are seeking passionate and experienced Near-Native English-speaking Online K-12 Math and/or Science Teachers with verifiable teaching certifications. The ideal candidates will have strong academic backgrounds in Mathematics and/or Science, experience teaching young learners (ages 5–18), and a commitment to creating a supportive, inquiry-based, and engaging online learning environment.



Responsibilities



Deliver interactive and engaging Math and/or Science lessons to individuals and small groups of 2–6 students aged 5–18.

Teach using internationally recognized curricula such as A Closer Look, Glencoe Science, Pearson Interactive Science, NGSS-aligned resources, Singapore Math, or IB/AP/A Level Math programs.

Create age-appropriate lesson plans focused on conceptual understanding, inquiry, problem-solving, and real-world applications.

Incorporate visuals, multimedia, and hands-on virtual activities to make abstract concepts accessible and engaging.

Monitor student progress and provide timely feedback to students and parents.

Foster curiosity, discussion, and active learning in a safe and supportive space.



Qualifications



Professional teacher with at least 2 years of teaching experience (Kindergarten–Grade 12).

Must hold a valid teaching license/certification (e.g., Teaching License, State Certification). TESOL/TEFL is a plus.

Near-native English accent with excellent spoken and written communication skills.

Strong academic background in Mathematics and/or Science (Biology, Physics, Chemistry, General Science).

Experience teaching in public/international schools or reputable online platforms.

Familiarity with inquiry-based and/or interdisciplinary approaches (e.g., STEM/STEAM).

Comfortable working between 07:00–22:00 (Weekdays) and 9:00–22:00 (Weekends), GMT+8.

Proficiency with digital platforms such as ClassIn, Microsoft Office, and other educational technologies.

Must have a stable and fast internet connection and a PC/laptop with at least Windows 10 or Mac OS Catalina.



Benefits



Flexible working hours.

Opportunity to teach using globally respected Math and Science curricula.

Be part of an international, passionate team of educators.

Access to training and professional development.

Regular enrollment model (not a booking system), ensuring schedule stability and consistency

The ideal candidates will have strong academic backgrounds in Mathematics and/or Science, experience teaching young learners (ages 5–18), and a commitment to creating a supportive, inquiry-based, and engaging online learning environment.

Deliver interactive and engaging Math and/or Science lessons to individuals and small groups of 2–6 students aged 5–18.

Teach using internationally recognized curricula such as A Closer Look, Glencoe Science, Pearson Interactive Science, NGSS-aligned resources, Singapore Math, or IB/AP/A Level Math programs.

Create age-appropriate lesson plans focused on conceptual understanding, inquiry, problem-solving, and real-world applications.

Incorporate visuals, multimedia, and hands-on virtual activities to make abstract concepts accessible and engaging.

Monitor student progress and provide timely feedback to students and parents.

Foster curiosity, discussion, and active learning in a safe and supportive space.



Qualifications



Professional teacher with at least 2 years of teaching experience (Kindergarten–Grade 12).

Must hold a valid teaching license/certification (e.g., Teaching License, State Certification). TESOL/TEFL is a plus.

Near-native English accent with excellent spoken and written communication skills.

Strong academic background in Mathematics and/or Science (Biology, Physics, Chemistry, General Science).

Experience teaching in public/international schools or reputable online platforms.

Familiarity with inquiry-based and/or interdisciplinary approaches (e.g., STEM/STEAM).

Comfortable working between 07:00–22:00 (Weekdays) and 9:00–22:00 (Weekends), GMT+8.

Proficiency with digital platforms such as ClassIn, Microsoft Office, and other educational technologies.

Must have a stable and fast internet connection and a PC/laptop with at least Windows 10 or Mac OS Catalina.



Benefits



Flexible working hours.

Opportunity to teach using globally respected Math and Science curricula.

Be part of an international, passionate team of educators.

Access to training and professional development.

Regular enrollment model (not a booking system), ensuring schedule stability and consistency

title: Youtube Manager
description:
Randa Media is growing again!



The Mission

We aren’t looking for someone to just "upload videos." We are looking for a YouTube Architect to join our social media team. Your mission is to bridge the gap between raw creative energy and algorithmic performance. You will be responsible for engineering virality, managing the high-stakes "First Hour" of every launch, and turning casual viewers into a loyal community. If you live for CTR spikes and retention graphs, this is your playground.



Core Responsibilities

1. Strategy & Growth

Packaging Mastermind: Own the "Big Three"—Ideation, Titles, and Thumbnails. You will collaborate with the creative team to ensure every video has a "lethal" hook before a single frame is filmed.



Retention Engineering: Audit scripts and rough cuts. You’ll identify "boredom leaks" and work with editors to ensure pacing keeps viewers glued to the screen.



Data-Driven Iteration: Conduct deep-dive audits of YouTube Analytics. You should be able to explain why a video underperformed and provide a concrete pivot strategy for the next one.



A/B Testing: Constantly rotate and test titles/thumbnails using tools to squeeze every bit of potential out of the library.



2. Publishing & Technical Ops

End-to-End Upload Management: Manage the entire "Publishing Checklist"—from raw file upload to final scheduling for peak audience activity.



Metadata Optimization: Write SEO-rich descriptions, keyword-optimized tags, and accurate Chapter Markers (timestamps) to help the algorithm categorize our content.



Feature Management: Execute "The Handshake"—optimizing End Screens and Info Cards to keep viewers on the channel, and setting up Pinned Comments to drive conversions.



Community Engagement: Own the "First Hour." You’ll be the voice of the channel, hearting and replying to top comments to signal high engagement to the algorithm.



Copyright & Compliance: Ensure all uploads are ad-suitable and resolve any Content ID or copyright issues before the video goes public.



Who You Are

Algorithm-Fluent: You understand CTR, AVD, and RPM like a second language.



Meticulous & Detail-Oriented: You never miss a broken link in a description or a typo in a thumbnail. You treat every upload like a high-stakes launch.



Psychology-Driven: You know how to leverage the "curiosity gap" without resorting to cheap clickbait.



The "Truth-Teller": You aren't afraid to tell the creative team that an idea "won't work for the algorithm," even if it’s a high-production concept.



Requirements

Proven Track Record: You have managed or grown a channel to [Insert Milestone, e.g., 100k+ subscribers] or have a portfolio of high-performing case studies.



Tool Kit: Proficient in YouTube Studio, [TubeBuddy/VidIQ], and Project Management software (Notion/Asana).



Visual Literacy: You don't need to be a designer, but you must be able to direct designers to create world-class, high-CTR thumbnails.



How to Apply

Generic resumes will be ignored. To be considered, please send:



The Evidence: Links to 1–2 channels you’ve managed or helped grow, including one specific "win" you're proud of.

The Audit: One specific thing you would change about our current YouTube channel to improve performance.

The Checklist: List the 5 most important things you check in YouTube Studio before hitting "Public."

The Favorite: Who is your favorite YouTuber right now, and what is one secret to their success?

title: Instagram Growth Strategist & Content Lead
description:
About 37 Projects

We are a leading video podcast marketing agency specializing in health and wellness content. We manage YouTube growth for top experts, nutritionists, and medical professionals, helping their content reach the right audience. Now, we’re looking for a Podcast Video Editor to join our team!



The Mission

We are launching and scaling a fitness & wellness Instagram account from the ground up.



This role is not about posting randomly.

It is about:

- Building a growth engine

- Reverse-engineering competitors

- Designing a 30/60/90-day roadmap

- Executing content daily

- Managing community engagement

- Tracking performance and iterating



You own the strategy and the execution.



Core Responsibilities

1. Competitive Intelligence & Market Research

You will:

- Research competitors in fitness & wellness

- Study accounts we provide (to model/mimic strategically)

- Break down:

  + Hooks

  + Post formats

  + Viral patterns

  + Messaging angles

  + Frequency

  + Engagement structure

- Translate findings into actionable strategy



We are not copying blindly.

We are extracting patterns and improving them.



2. 30 / 60 / 90 Day Content Roadmap

You will build:

- A detailed 30-day content calendar

- A 60-day optimization projection

- A 90-day growth direction



Posting cadence:

- 2 static posts per day

- 4–5 short-form videos per week

- Daily Instagram Stories



Everything must align with one strategic positioning.



3. Content Creation & Scriptwriting

You will:

- Design static and carousel posts

- Write scripts for 30–60 sec short-form videos

- Create strong first-3-second hooks

- Develop angles based on trends + competitor research

- Adapt trends intelligently to fitness/wellness audience



Videos will be produced via UGC AI tools or UGC creators.

You are responsible for concept, script and execution via UGC platforms.



4. Community Management & Engagement (Critical)

You will actively manage the account:

- Reply to comments daily

- Engage in meaningful conversations

- Pin strategic comments

- Spark discussions

- Respond to DMs professionally

- Monitor audience sentiment



You understand that: Engagement drives distribution.



This is not passive.

You help build the community, not just content.



5. Execution & Visual Direction

- Maintain brand consistency

- Ensure clean and recognizable aesthetic

- Use tools like Canva, Figma, or similar

- Align visuals with performance goals

- Optimize captions for saves and shares



6. Analytics & Performance Optimization

Weekly & monthly reporting must include:

- Reach

- Engagement rate

- Saves

- Shares

- Watch time / retention (for videos)

- Follower growth

- Content format performance



You must clearly identify:

- What to stop

- What to scale

- What to test next

- What to double down on



We operate based on data, not assumptions.



Ideal Candidate Profile



You:

- Think like a strategist

- Act like an operator

- Understand Instagram psychology

- Can reverse-engineer competitors

- Write compelling short-form scripts

- Are deeply interested in fitness & wellness trends

- Know how to build engagement early-stage accounts



Bonus if you:

- Use AI tools effectively (ChatGPT, Claude, etc.)

- Understand UGC content systems

- Have grown accounts from scratch

- Can interpret retention data



Success Metrics

- Consistent daily execution

- Follower growth trajectory

- Increasing saves & shares

- Strong engagement rate

- Clear content evolution month over month

- Active, engaged comment section



This Is Not For You If

- You only schedule posts

- You avoid data

- You don’t enjoy engagement

- You need constant micro-direction

- You don’t understand hooks and audience psychology



How to apply:

Fill up this form:

title: Full-Time Virtual Assistant
description:
URGENT: Full-Time Virtual Assistant 



Company: Sustainable Change

Location: Remote (Philippines-based applicants only)

Hours: Full-Time (40 hours per week)

Salary: Competitive

Start Date: March 2nd



About Us:



At Sustainable Change, our mission is to help 1 million people live longer, healthier, and happier lives through sustainable weight loss and health transformations.



We’ve already helped thousands of women achieve life-changing results — from reversing diabetes to regaining mobility, energy, and confidence.



As we continue to grow, we are looking for a highly organized and proactive Virtual Assistant to support our operations and client management systems.



The Role:



We are hiring a full-time Virtual Assistant to provide administrative, CRM, and customer review support to our growing team.



This role includes managing and responding to all customer reviews across platforms. You will be responsible for ensuring each review response accurately reflects the customer’s complete experience and aligns with our brand tone.



This is not a copy-paste or AI-only role. It requires human judgment, strong writing ability, emotional intelligence, and attention to detail.



If you are thoughtful, analytical, and confident in written communication, this could be a great fit.



Key Responsibilities:



CRM & Data Management

Client Coordination

* Support scheduling, follow-ups, and internal coordination

* Ensure client information is properly documented



Customer Review Management

* Monitor and respond to customer reviews across platforms

* Gather necessary information internally before responding

* Ensure responses are personalized, accurate, and brand-aligned



General Administrative Support

* Assist with day-to-day admin tasks

* Help improve and streamline internal processes



Requirements:



* Experience with CRM systems 

* Familiarity with Canva and Trainerize is a strong advantage

* Excellent written English communication skills

* Background in writing, marketing, psychology, communications, or related field preferred

* Highly dependable and able to work independently

* Strong research and data-gathering skills

* High attention to detail and emotional intelligence

* Available to start in a full-time position

* Based in the Philippines with a strong internet connection and quiet workspace

* No agencies — direct hire only



How to Apply:



Send your latest resume and a five-minute Loom video introducing yourself and sharing why you’re a great fit for this role to

Applications without the exact subject line will not be considered. No LinkedIn DMs. Only applications sent to the

We can’t wait to meet you!

title: Content Writer
description:
Location: Remote

Employment Type:  Full-Time (8 hours/day)

Reports To: Lead Generation Manager

Department: Lead Generation

Engagement Classification: Independent Contractor



Summary:



The Content Writer is responsible for driving qualified leads through authoritative, search-optimized content that positions CKIM as a recognized authority in luxury yacht charter.

This role develops high-performing content aligned with SEO, Search GPT, AEO, GEO, and E-E-A-T standards to increase visibility, strengthen authority, and generate measurable marketing results.





Key Responsibilities:



Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

• Develop high-converting, SEO-, AEO-, and GEO-optimized content aligned with CKIM’s luxury brand positioning.

• Structure content strategically for visibility across traditional search engines and AI-driven search platforms (including Search GPT environments).

• Create authoritative, experience-driven content that reflects E-E-A-T standards, incorporating accurate information, expert positioning, credible references, and real-world insights.

• Collaborate with leadership, freelance writers, SEO specialists, and designers to execute an integrated content strategy.

• Publish approved content across digital platforms (website, landing pages, blog,
 campaigns, lead magnets).

• Monitor and analyze website analytics, search rankings, AI visibility signals, engagement, and conversion performance.

• Provide data-driven recommendations to continuously improve content effectiveness and lead acquisition outcomes.

• Edit and elevate existing copy to ensure clarity, brand consistency, authority positioning, and premium tone.

• Research luxury travel trends, yacht charter market developments, and competitive positioning to inform strategic content direction.

• Maintain an editorial calendar and ensure timely, consistent content production.

• Continuously refine messaging and structure to strengthen CKIM’s topical authority and search credibility.





Required Education & Experience:



• Minimum 3+ years of proven experience in content marketing, digital marketing, or strategic copywriting with measurable performance outcomes.

• Bachelor’s degree in Communications, Marketing, Journalism, or related discipline strongly preferred.

• Demonstrated experience writing for luxury, travel, hospitality, high-net-worth clientele, or premium service brands strongly preferred.

• Advanced understanding of traditional SEO, including keyword strategy, search intent mapping, internal linking strategy, structured content formatting, and on-page optimization.

• Working knowledge of Search GPT visibility, Answer Engine Optimization (AEO), and Generative Engine Optimization (GEO), including structuring content for AI-driven search platforms, conversational search queries, featured snippets, and knowledge retrieval systems.

• Demonstrated ability to create content aligned with E-E-A-T (Experience, Expertise, Authoritativeness, Trustworthiness) standards — incorporating credible sourcing, real-world insights, expert positioning, accuracy, and trust-building signals.

• Experience optimizing content for discoverability across both traditional search engines and AI-powered search environments.

• Proficiency with analytics and reporting tools (e.g., Google Analytics, Google Search Console, SEO platforms) and ability to translate data into actionable optimization strategies.

• Advanced proficiency in Microsoft 365 (Teams, Word, Excel, Planner, SharePoint, PowerPoint).

• Proven ability to manage multiple projects, maintain editorial calendars, and meet deadlines in a remote environment.

• Exceptional written and verbal communication skills with strong editorial judgment and brand voice alignment.

• Demonstrated commitment to continuous improvement, testing, iteration, and performance refinement (Kaizen mindset).

title: Master Video Editor Wanted (For One Of The World’s Largest YouTube Education Channels)
description:
— WHO WE ARE —



We’re a small group of timeline-hacking, status-quo-bucking, out-of-the-box thinking, digital gangsters breaking out YouTube education content with the passion of a thousand suns :D



On a serious note, we create industry-leading content to help YouTubers grow their channels on the ‘Marcus Jones’ channel 
 









— WHO WE‘RE LOOKING FOR —



We’re looking for remote, experienced YouTube Editors + Animators, who want to be on the cutting-edge of YouTube editing.



Here are the main things we’re looking for in our applicants:



VIDEO EDITING (Required): Obviously, you must be an exceptionally talented video editor from a technical perspective. However, you must also have the passion, creativity, and sense of humor to be able to turn bland, average footage into highly engaging videos that educate AND entertain viewers.



ANIMATION (Required): You must be capable of creating high-quality 2d overlay, titling, and keyframing animations that visually illustrate the concepts we discuss in our videos.



AMBITION: We have a friendly and supportive team culture, but expect to be held to exceptionally high standards because our goal is to become the #1 YouTube Education channel in the world in 2026. So if you hate going hard, dealing with lots of revisions/feedback, or innovating, you won’t fit in here.







— WHAT'S IN IT FOR YOU —



Here are just some of the areas where you’ll have the opportunity to learn and grow at our company.



STABLE & SECURE: No more uncertainty from wishy-washy clients. You get a guaranteed monthly paycheck. 



LEADERSHIP OPPORTUNITIES: If you prove yourself, you will likely be presented with senior leadership opportunities down the track.



WORK WITH THE BEST: With us, you get to learn from and work with people who are constantly striving to be the best YouTube editors in the world. We’ve got each other’s backs, but we also hold each other to very high standards.



FLEXIBLE WORK HOURS: You can choose your working hours. However, we expect you to make yourself available for tea
etings (We’re based in Sydney Austraila, and tea
etings are usually in the early afternoon).







— TO APPLY —

title: Software Engineer (Direct Client)
description:
Role Title: Software Engineer

Department: Development

Reports To: Director of Development

Location: Remote

Employment Type: Full-time





Position Overview

We are seeking a skilled Software Engineer to join our development team. This role requires a versatile developer capable of bridging modern web application development with lower-level system programming. The ideal candidate will have strong proficiency in C# and the ASP.NET Core framework for building robust web solutions, alongside a solid working knowledge of C for embedded devices.



Key Responsibilities

Application Development: Design, build, and maintain efficient, reusable, and reliable code using C# and ASP.NET Core.

System Integration: Utilize C programming knowledge to maintain existing modules, develop interfaces for hardware interaction, or manage Inter-Process Communication (IPC) between managed and unmanaged code.

Full Lifecycle Engineering: Participate in the entire software development lifecycle, from requirement analysis and prototyping to testing, deployment, and maintenance.

Performance Optimization: Analyze and optimize application performance, troubleshooting bottlenecks in 
 and C-based components.

Database Management: Design and maintain database schemas and write efficient SQL queries to support application data needs.

Code Review & Quality: Conduct peer code reviews, write unit and integration tests, and ensure adherence to coding standards and best practices.



Technical Requirements

Essential Skills

C# & .NET Core: Extensive experience with C# (latest versions) and 
 Core / .NET 5+ ecosystem. Strong understanding of object-oriented programming, dependency injection, and asynchronous programming patterns.

ASP.NET Core: Proven experience building web applications and RESTful APIs using ASP.NET Core.

C Programming: Functional knowledge of C. Ability to read, debug, and write C code, specifically in contexts involving memory management, pointers, and interoperability (e.g., P/Invoke).

Database Technologies: Experience with relational databases (e.g., SQL Server, PostgreSQL) and ORM frameworks like Entity Framework Core or Dapper.

Version Control: Proficiency with Git and branching strategies (e.g., Gitflow).



Desirable Skills

Web Front-End: Familiarity with front-end technologies such as HTML, CSS, JavaScript, and frameworks like Bootstrap or Blazor.

API Documentation: Experience with Swagger/OpenAPI for documenting API specifications.

CI/CD: Understanding of Continuous Integration and Continuous Deployment pipelines (e.g., Azure DevOps, GitHub Actions).

Hardware/Embedded: Basic understanding of hardware interfacing or embedded systems is a plus.



Qualifications

Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field (or equivalent practical experience).

2 years of professional experience in software development.

Personal Attributes

Problem Solver: Analytical mindset with a strong aptitude for debugging complex issues across different technology stacks.

Communicator: Ability to explain technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders and collaborate effectively within a team.

Continuous Learner: Passion for staying updated with the latest industry trends and technologies.

title: SEO Specialist

title: Full Time Remote Customer Support Assistant
description:
We are building a distributed support team and are looking for a Customer Support Assistant who takes written communication seriously and values consistency in their work. This is a full-time remote position designed for someone who wants dependable income, clear expectations, and the chance to grow within a structured environment over time.



This role is not project-based or temporary. We are looking for someone who wants stability, is comfortable working set hours, and understands that strong support is built on reliability and attention to detail.



You will spend your workday handling customer conversations through written messages. Your responsibility is to provide clear, accurate, and professional responses while maintaining a friendly tone. You will work within defined guidelines, manage several conversations at the same time, and ensure users receive timely and helpful replies. Part of the role also involves flagging recurring issues, technical problems, or useful feedback so the team can improve processes and systems.

Full onboarding and training are provided before you begin working independently.



This role requires strong written English and a typing speed of at least 60 words per minute. You must have a reliable internet connection of 50-100 Mbps or higher. A dependable laptop or desktop computer with at least 8 GB of RAM is required.



You should be available full-time for a consistent schedule of eight hours per day, six days per week. We value people who are detail-oriented, professional in their communication, dependable in meeting expectations, and open to feedback and improvement.



Previous experience in customer support, chat-based roles, or remote work is helpful but not required.



The hourly pay for this position ranges from 4 to 6 USD, depending on experience and performance.

In addition to base pay, there are performance-based bonuses, regular reviews, and opportunities for raises. Team members who consistently perform well can grow into higher-responsibility and higher-paying roles over time.



Why Join Us?

You’ll be working remotely in a structured environment with clear systems, training, and expectations. This role is ideal for someone who wants long-term stability rather than short-term gigs, and who values growth through consistent performance.



Apply now by sending us a message with all relevant information mentioned above and we look forward to having you!

title: Head of Brand & Digital operations
description:
Head of Brand & Digital Operations



Multi-Brand Portfolio – Manufacturing, Cannabis & Retail



About Us



We are a vertically integrated company operating:

 • Manufacturing (BHO products & cartridges)

 • 5 product brands

 • 1 cannabis brand

 • 3 retail store locations



We are entering a professionalization phase and are looking for a high-level operator to bring structure, consistency, and strategic elevation across our entire brand and digital ecosystem.



This is not a virtual assistant role.

This is a leadership role.



You will report directly to the CEO.



?



Role Overview



You will own all brand and digital presentation across our portfolio.



Your first priority is to standardize and organize.

Your second priority is to strategically elevate.



You will not be expected to do all production work yourself. You will manage freelancers and contractors where appropriate (designers, developers, content creators, etc.).



We are looking for someone who thinks in systems, not tasks.



?



Phase 1: Control & Standardize

 • Audit all brands (5 manufacturing brands + cannabis brand + retail brand)

 • Standardize SKU naming conventions

 • Clean up and optimize menu structure (Leafly, Dutchie, etc.)

 • Organize digital assets and packaging files

 • Align brand presentation across websites, social, retail, and packaging

 • Create documentation and internal brand guidelines

 • Standardize product descriptions and retail presentation formats



?



Phase 2: Elevate

 • Improve packaging sophistication and direction

 • Oversee website rebuild(s) and UX improvements

 • Strengthen differentiation between product brands

 • Implement structured social media systems

 • Develop product launch playbooks

 • Improve overall digital and retail presentation quality



?



What This Role Is NOT

 • Not a virtual assistant

 • Not just a social media manager

 • Not just a graphic designer

 • Not a task-taker



We are looking for a strategic operator who can build systems, manage complexity, and lead execution.



?



Required Experience

 • Experience managing multiple brands at once

 • Strong systems and process thinking

 • Experience overseeing designers and developers

 • Experience improving website structure and UX

 • Strong written and verbal English communication

 • Comfortable managing freelancers and enforcing deadlines

 • Highly organized and deadline-driven

 • Retail or regulated industry experience is a plus



?



What We’re Looking For



Someone who:

 • Thinks in 30/60/90-day plans

 • Identifies problems without being told

 • Builds structure before jumping into redesign

 • Can manage complexity without becoming overwhelmed

 • Communicates clearly and professionally

 • Is comfortable working directly with a CEO

 • Wants long-term growth with a growing company



?



Compensation

 • Full-time

 • $2,000/month (based on experience)

 • Long-term opportunity

 • Performance-based increases possible



?



Hiring Process



We take this role seriously and are hiring for long-term leadership.



Our process includes:

 1. Application review

 2. Video interview(s)

 3. Paid strategic assessment for shortlisted candidates



The paid assessment (approximately 5–7 hours of work) will involve reviewing part of our brand and digital ecosystem and presenting:

 • Key weaknesses and opportunities

 • Quick wins

 • A structured 90-day improvement roadmap

 • Recommended systems to install



This is a paid assignment. We respect your time and will compensate selected candidates for this step.



We are evaluating strategic thinking, organization, and leadership ability — not looking for free labor.



?



Application Instructions



To apply, please answer the following:

 1. If hired, what would your first 30 days look like in this role?

 2. Describe a time you improved a disorganized system across multiple brands.

 3. Have you managed designers or developers before? If yes, explain how.

 4. Provide examples of brands or digital ecosystems you’ve helped organize or elevate.



Applications without detailed responses will not be considered.



?

title: Amazon SEO Expert
description:
About Us

We are a fast-growing Amazon agency dedicated to helping brands maximize their visibility, conversion rates, and overall sales performance on Amazon globally. From advertising and SEO to content and operations, we manage every aspect of our clients' Amazon presence.

To expand our team, we are looking for a skilled Amazon SEO & Listing Optimization Expert who will take ownership of creating high-converting product listings and image strategies across all Amazon marketplaces.

________________________________________

Key Responsibilities

SEO & Listing Optimization

• Optimize product listings (titles, bullet points, descriptions, backend keywords) for maximum visibility and conversion using SEO best practices.

• Perform in-depth keyword research and competitor analysis to uncover ranking opportunities and content gaps.

• Collaborate on A/B testing of copy elements to improve CTR and CVR.

Image Strategy & Planning

• Develop data-driven image plans for each product (main image, gallery, infographics, and lifestyle shots).

• Align visuals with brand guidelines and Amazon best practices.

• Work with designers and content creators to bring image concepts to life that communicate key benefits and drive engagement.

Cross-Team Collaboration

• Coordinate with PPC Specialists, Account Managers, and Designers to ensure listings and images support the overall marketing strategy.

• Provide SEO input during product launches and seasonal campaigns.

Performance Monitoring & Reporting

• Track keyword rankings, search term performance, and conversion metrics to identify optimization opportunities.

• Share regular insights and reports on content and image performance.

________________________________________

Qualifications

• Proven experience in Amazon SEO and listing optimization (Seller Central and/or Vendor Central).

• Strong knowledge of keyword tools (e.g., Helium 10, DataDive, or similar) and listing performance metrics.

• Experience planning and briefing high-performing Amazon images.

• Proficient in flat file templates and bulk uploads.

• Excellent attention to detail, analytical thinking, and problem-solving skills.

• Solid Excel skills and familiarity with Amazon tools or third-party platforms.

• Fluent in English (spoken and written); other languages are a plus.

________________________________________

What We Offer

• A dynamic and supportive remote team.

• Opportunities to work with leading brands and global markets.

• Flexible working hours and remote-first culture.

• Professional development opportunities in the Amazon space.

• A results-driven environment with room to grow and innovate.

description:
We are actively hiring a high-level Social Media Strategist & GoHighLevel (GHL) expert with proven experience in the credit repair industry.



This is NOT an entry-level role. We are looking for someone with 3+ years of hands-on experience who is strategic, analytical, and intentional. We are not looking for someone who posts just to be posting. Every move must have purpose, positioning, and a clear conversion strategy behind it.



We specifically need someone who has strong expertise in optimizing and fully revamping social media platforms someone who knows how to structure profiles for authority, visibility, engagement, and lead generation.



If you understand branding, funnels, automation, and scaling service-based businesses, keep reading.



Key Responsibilities:



Conduct full social media audits across all platforms



Optimize bios, messaging, highlights, branding, and overall positioning



Lead rebranding efforts based on competitor 

research and market positioning



Develop and execute a strategic, conversion-focused content plan



Manage and grow platforms with intentional lead-generation systems



Build, optimize, and manage GoHighLevel automations, funnels, and workflows



Streamline lead capture, follow-up, and nurturing sequences



Create scalable systems that increase conversions and support long-term growth



Collaborate on high-level scaling strategies



Requirements:



3+ years of experience in social media strategy and digital marketing



Direct experience in the credit repair industry (REQUIRED)



Advanced GoHighLevel automation and funnel expertise



Proven experience optimizing and positioning social media platforms for growth



Strong CRM and lead generation background



Experience scaling online service-based businesses



Strategic thinker with data-driven decision-making skills



Available during U.S. business hours

Reliable, proactive, and results-driven

Position Type:

Full-Time

Must be available during U.S. business hours.



If you meet these qualifications, send a message detailing your experience. You may also include your WhatsApp number for faster communication.



Serious, experienced professionals only. We are building to scale strategically not randomly.

Is this conversation helpful so far?

title: Website Maintenance Coordinator
description:
Role Overview

The Website Maintenance Coordinator is responsible for keeping all client and internal websites accurate, updated, optimized, and conversion-ready. This role is not about redesigning websites—it’s about maintaining performance, consistency, and reliability.



You are the person who ensures:

Nothing breaks

Nothing goes outdated

Nothing sits unfinished

Core Responsibilities

Website Maintenance & Updates



Publish and update blog content (content provided)

Upload and format blog cover images and graphics

Update copy, CTAs, pages, and links as requested

Perform routine site health checks (desktop + mobile)

Performance & Quality Control



Conduct regular audits for broken links, errors, and outdated content

Ensure sites remain fast, responsive, and mobile-friendly

Verify tracking, forms, and CTAs are functioning correctly

Ad & Marketing Support



Create and update landing pages for ads and campaigns

Ensure ad pages align with conversion and tracking requirements

Coordinate updates tied to marketing launches or promotions

Organization & Reporting



Maintain a clear log of website changes and updates

Complete weekly or EOD website status reports

Communicate issues, risks, or delays proactively

What You’re NOT Responsible For

Designing websites from scratch

Writing long-form content

Running ad campaigns

Strategy decisions (those are provided)

Execution and consistency are the priority.

Required Skills



Strong understanding of website platforms (WordPress, Webflow, or similar)

Comfort with basic HTML/CSS and CMS tools

Attention to detail (this is non-negotiable)

Ability to follow SOPs and checklists

Clear communication and reliability

Nice-to-Have (But Not Required)

Experience supporting ad landing pages

Familiarity with SEO basics



Experience working in an agency or multi-client environment

Understanding of analytics or conversion tracking

Success in This Role Looks Like

Websites are always current, accurate, and functional

No surprises, no broken pages, no missed updates

Marketing and ad teams never wait on website changes

Clear reporting and strong follow-through

Who This Role Is Best For

Detail-oriented operators



Interns or early-career professionals looking to grow

Technically capable coordinators who value structure

People who take ownership and finish what they start

title: Ecommerce Merchandiser Assistant
description:
Position Overview

We are seeking an Ecommerce Merchandising Assistant with hands-on experience managing product content across multiple retailer portals. This role will support our Salsify Product Owner in syndicating and optimizing product data for Wayfair, Walmart, Amazon, and other key partners. Experience with Home Depot, Target, Lowe’s, and Kohl’s is a strong plus. The ideal candidate is detail-oriented, organized, and skilled at ensuring product listings meet the unique requirements of each platform.



Key Responsibilities

• Syndicate product content from our PIM (Salsify) to multiple retailer portals, including Wayfair, Walmart, Amazon, and others.

• Acquire and organize product data to maximize attribution and content completeness during the new product build process.

• Ensure product listings are fully compliant with each retailer’s standards and optimized for visibility.

• Collaborate cross-functionally to gather and verify accurate product information.

• Troubleshoot and resolve product data issues across retailer portals.

• Support the merchandising team in driving efficiency and consistency across platforms.



Qualifications

• 2+ years of ecommerce merchandising, content syndication, or product data management experience.

• Proven experience working with multiple major retailers (Wayfair, Walmart, Amazon required; Home Depot, Target, Lowe’s, Kohl’s a plus).

• Experience with Salsify (or similar PIM platforms).

• Strong organizational skills, with a focus on accuracy and detail.

• Ability to juggle multiple priorities and meet deadlines in a fast-paced environment.

• Excellent communication and problem-solving skills.



Why Join Us

• Opportunity to work with a broad and diverse ecommerce product portfolio.

• Hands-on experience with leading retailers and product syndication technology.

• Collaborative team environment with growth potential in ecommerce merchandising.

• Play a key role in helping products go live across today’s top online retailers.

title: eCommerce Merchandising Assistant
description:
eCommerce Merchandising Assistant (Walmart & Target Focus) 



We are seeking a detail-oriented and motivated eCommerce Merchandising Assistant to join our growing team. This full-time, remote position is ideal for early-career professionals looking to build a long-term career in digital retail, with a strong focus on supporting and growing our business across Walmart and Target online platforms. 



This role will support day-to-day merchandising execution, content optimization, promotional coordination, and performance reporting across key 
 accounts. The ideal candidate has experience working with Walmart or Target portals, is analytical, highly organized, eager to learn, and comfortable working cross-functionally in a fast-paced retail environment.  



Shape 



Key Responsibilities 



Retailer Merchandising & Execution 



Support daily merchandising activities across 
 and 
, ensuring product listings are live and sellable, optimized, accurate, and aligned with retailer guidelines. 



Assist with maintaining and updating product content including titles, bullet points, descriptions, images, specifications, and enhanced content modules. 



Track pricing, competitive activity, and category trends, escalating insights and recommendations to senior tea
mbers. 



Support promotional execution including retailer events, seasonal campaigns, rollback pricing, and digital features. 



Help coordinate new product launches by partnering with internal Product, Marketing, and Supply Chain teams to ensure accurate data, imagery, and forecasting support. 



Shape 



Sales & Performance Support 



Analyze weekly sales, traffic, and conversion data from Walmart and Target reporting tools to identify trends and performance opportunities. 



Build and maintain recurring performance reports in Excel, highlighting key insights and actionable recommendations. 



Partner with paid media and retail media teams to ensure content and keyword alignment supports discoverability and conversion. 



Support revenue forecasting and promotional planning through historical sales analysis and post-promotion recaps. 



Shape 



Required Qualifications 



1–2 years of experience in eCommerce, digital merchandising, or retailer account support — experience with 
 and/or 
 strongly preferred. 



Strong analytical skills with proficiency in Microsoft Excel (pivot tables, lookups, basic data analysis). 



High attention to detail with strong organizational and time management skills. 



Ability to manage multiple projects and deadlines in a fast-paced retail environment. 



Strong written and verbal communication skills and ability to collaborate cross-functionally. 



Must be able to work 8am-5pm EST hours.  



Shape 



Preferred Qualifications 



Experience working within Walmart Retail Link, Walmart Supplier One, Walmart Seller Center, Target Partners Online (POL), or similar retailer reporting platforms. 



Familiarity with Product Information Management (PIM) systems such as Salsify or similar tools. 



Basic understanding of digital shelf optimization, keyword strategy, and retailer search functionality. 



Exposure to retailer promotional mechanics, site features, and seasonal merchandising calendars. 



 



 



Shape 



Why Join Us 

 



This position is well-suited for someone looking to grow their career in eCommerce merchandising within major omnichannel retailers. Through this role, you will gain hands-on experience in digital shelf optimization, retailer reporting, and cross-functional collaboration. 

 

• Opportunity to work with abroad and diverse ecommerce product portfolio. 

• Hands-on experience with leading retailers and product syndication technology. 

• Collaborative team environment with growth potential in ecommerce merchandising. 

• Play a key role in helping products go live across today’s top online retailers.

title: Virtual Technical Document Writer & Document Controller – Aconex, D2, DMS Specialist (Construction, Mining & Energy)
description:
JOB DESCRIPTION:

We are seeking a detail-oriented and experienced Virtual Technical Document Writer and Document Controller with proven proficiency in industry-leading document management systems including Aconex, OpenText D2 (Documentum), and other enterprise DMS platforms. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in producing, managing, and controlling technical documentation for projects across the construction, mining, energy, and heavy industrial sectors.

Key Responsibilities:

Technical Document Writing:

 ? Develop, write, edit, and format technical documents including engineering reports, scope of works, method statements, standard operating procedures (SOPs), work instructions, and technical specifications

 ? Prepare project management documentation such as project execution plans (PEPs), project management plans (PMPs), commissioning plans, handover documentation, and close-out reports

 ? Write and compile HSE documentation including SWMS (Safe Work Method Statements), JHAs (Job Hazard Analyses), environmental management plans, and safety procedures

 ? Produce quality management documentation including ITPs (Inspection & Test Plans), quality plans, NCR registers, and audit reports

 ? Create asset and maintenance documentation including maintenance strategies, equipment manuals, and O&M (Operations & Maintenance) manuals

 ? Develop templates, style guides, and standardised formats to ensure consistency across all project documentation

 ? Translate complex technical information from engineers, project managers, and subject matter experts into clear, concise, and professionally formatted documents

 ? Review and proofread existing documentation for accuracy, consistency, grammar, and compliance with project and corporate standards

 ? Prepare tender and bid documentation including expressions of interest, prequalification submissions, and capability statements

Document Control & Management:

 ? Administer and manage project document control systems including Oracle Aconex, OpenText D2 (Documentum), SharePoint, Procore, and other enterprise DMS platforms

 ? Establish and maintain document control procedures, numbering conventions, revision control protocols, and metadata standards

 ? Process, register, distribute, and track all incoming and outgoing project documentation including transmittals, drawings, correspondence, and technical submittals

 ? Manage document workflows including review cycles, approval processes, and controlled distribution in accordance with project requirements

 ? Maintain master document registers (MDRs), drawing registers, correspondence logs, and transmittal records with real-time accuracy

 ? Perform regular audits of document control systems to ensure compliance with project procedures, corporate standards, and contractual obligations

 ? Control superseded and obsolete documents ensuring only current revisions are accessible and in circulation

 ? Manage the handover of documentation packages at project milestones including mechanical completion, practical completion, and final close-out

 ? Set up and configure DMS platforms for new projects including folder structures, permission matrices, user access controls, and workflow templates

 ? Train and support project tea
mbers on document management system usage, protocols, and best practices

 ? Generate document control reports, status dashboards, and KPI metrics for project management and stakeholder review

 ? Coordinate with engineering, procurement, construction, and commissioning teams to ensure timely submission and approval of documentation deliverables

 ? Manage vendor and subcontractor document submissions ensuring compliance with project document requirements and specifications

Industry-Specific Documentation Experience:

 ? Prepare and manage documentation packages for civil, structural, and mechanical engineering works across construction, mining, and energy projects

 ? Develop and control documentation aligned with EPCM/EPC project delivery frameworks

 ? Produce brownfield and greenfield project documentation including feasibility studies, FEED documentation, and detailed design packages

 ? Manage site-specific documentation including mobilisation packs, site establishment plans, camp management documentation, and logistics registers

 ? Compile and control regulatory and statutory compliance documentation including environmental approvals, mining permits, development applications, and safety case submissions

 ? Prepare and maintain asset registers, equipment datasheets, and technical data packages for handover to operations and maintenance teams

 ? Support shutdown, turnaround, and outage documentation requirements for mining processing plants, power stations, and industrial facilities

 ? Manage as-built documentation, redline markups, and final record drawing packages

Required Qualifications & Experience:

 ? Minimum 5 years’ experience in technical document writing and/or document control roles

 ? Demonstrated proficiency in Oracle Aconex including transmittal management, workflow configuration, mail management, and reporting

 ? Hands-on experience with OpenText D2 (Documentum) including content management, metadata configuration, and lifecycle management

 ? Experience with additional DMS platforms such as SharePoint, Procore, Assai, Meridian, ProjectWise, or Objective is highly regarded

 ? Proven experience across at least two of the following sectors: construction, mining, oil & gas, energy, or heavy industrial

 ? Strong understanding of civil, structural, and mechanical engineering documentation and terminology

 ? Excellent technical writing skills with the ability to produce clear, professional, and standards-compliant documentation

 ? Advanced proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook) including document formatting, templates, and macros

 ? Knowledge of document control standards and best practices including ISO 9001, AS/NZS standards, and project-specific documentation requirements

 ? Familiarity with engineering drawing conventions, revision control, and transmittal processes

 ? Strong understanding of HSE documentation requirements and compliance frameworks relevant to construction, mining, and energy industries

 ? Exceptional attention to detail, organisational skills, and ability to manage high volumes of documentation simultaneously

 ? Excellent written and verbal English communication skills

 ? Self-motivated and capable of working independently in a remote/virtual environment with minimal supervision

Preferred:

 ? Bachelor’s degree in Engineering, Technical Communication, Information Management, or a related field

 ? Experience working on Australian, Middle Eastern, or Southeast Asian projects

 ? Familiarity with EDMS migration projects and data cleansing/remediation activities

 ? Knowledge of BIM (Building Information Modelling) documentation workflows

 ? Experience with Adobe Acrobat Pro, Bluebeam Revu, or similar markup and PDF management tools

 ? Understanding of CMMS integration and the relationship between document control and asset/maintenance data management (SAP, Pronto, MEX)

 ? Experience with Power BI or similar tools for document control reporting and dashboards

 ? Familiarity with contract documentation and administration (AS4000, AS4902, NEC, FIDIC)

 ? Knowledge of records management principles and archival standards

 ? Experience supporting multi-discipline project teams across remote and FIFO site environments

This is a fully remote position. Candidates must have a reliable high-speed internet connection, a professional home office setup, and be available for meetings across Australian or international time zones as required.

title: UGC & Influencer Sourcing VA (X-Deals)
description:
Job Title



UGC & Influencer Sourcing VA (X-Deals)



Salary



PHP 15,000 per month

Remote | Output-Based Role



About the Role



We’re looking for someone with proven experience in sourcing and managing creators for UGC and X-deal collaborations.



This is not an hourly job.

This is a deliverables-based role.



As long as you complete the required outputs you’re good!



Deliverables



You will be responsible for:



1. UGC Sourcing

• 50 approved UGC videos per month, from xdeals/influencers

• or 25 UGCs every 2 weeks

• Creators must follow brief and brand direction,

• Content must be usable for ads and organic



2. Creator Outreach & Coordination

• Daily outreach to potential creators

• Clear communication of deliverables and deadlines

• Ensure creators submit content on time

• Follow up consistently

• Create briefs/guidelines for the influencers



3. Tracking & SOP Compliance

• Follow SOP

• Maintain and update tracking sheets daily

• Track shipping, content submission, posting, and approvals

• Quality check before content is endorsed



Requirements

• Previous experience in influencer or UGC sourcing (required)

• Has handled creator outreach before

• Knows how to evaluate creator profiles (engagement, quality, fit)

• Organized and comfortable using trackers

• Can manage multiple creators at once



You must be proactive, detail-oriented, and comfortable sending outreach messages daily!



To Apply

Please send:



• Your previous experience in influencer/UGC sourcing

• Sample outreach message you’ve used before

• Estimated number of creators you can message daily

• Confirmation you can source 50 UGCs per month



We’re excited to see your experience and approach!

title: Marketing Project Manager
description:
Job Title: Marketing Project Manager (Freelance | Remote | U.S. Hours)

Company: Alpha Co. Marketing & Media

Location: 100% Remote (CST Timezone)

Compensation: $6/hr



About the Team:

At Alpha Co., we’re a fully remote digital marketing team dedicated to helping businesses grow through digital commerce. We value collaboration, accountability, and continuous learning. Our Marketing Assistants play an essential role in supporting client relationships, organizing marketing tasks, and ensuring smooth communication across teams. We provide training, structured support, and opportunities to grow within the company.



Role Overview:

We’re looking for a proactive Marketing Assistant who can communicate clearly, stay organized, and support day-to-day operations across multiple client accounts. This role involves assisting with client communication, coordinating marketing-related tasks, conducting research, and helping keep projects moving efficiently.



Key Responsibilities:

• Handle daily client communication and provide updates on marketing tasks

• Coordinate client feedback and relay requests to internal tea
mbers

• Join client meetings and take clear, structured notes

• Support basic SEO-related tasks when needed

• Help maintain strong client relationships and positive engagement

• Organize tasks, deadlines, and follow-ups across multiple marketing activities

• Assist with research for campaigns, competitors, and client needs

• Help prepare, organize, or format marketing materials and documents

• Keep marketing files, updates, and communication well-organized

• Provide general administrative and marketing support as needed



Requirements:

• Strong English communication skills (written and verbal)

• Organized, detail-oriented, and proactive

• Customer-first attitude with strong relationship-building skills

• Ability to follow processes and meet deadlines consistently

• Reliable internet connection; able to work U.S. hours

• Experience in admin, coordination, or marketing is a plus

• Basic knowledge of digital marketing is an advantage

• Willingness to learn new tools, platforms, and skills



Benefits:

• Paid in USD ($6/hr)

• Flexible hours, fully remote

• Work from anywhere with internet access

• Opportunities for personal and professional development

title: Property Manager - (Operations & Finance)
description:
*Must be proficient in English*



Hi, I’m TJ, founder of Yesler Capital, a small but growing real estate and property management company based in MA (U.S)



I’m currently running everything by myself and looking for one full-time, long-term virtual assistant to work only with me as my right hand.



This isn’t a short-term gig — it’s a chance to become the first tea
mber in a business that’s growing. I’m not a big company, but I care deeply about the people I work with. If you’re loyal, honest, and take initiative, I’ll always treat you with respect, pay you on time, and help you grow personally and professionally. You’ll be part of the family here.



Must-Haves:



*Excellent spoken and written English — you’ll speak with tenants, vendors, and contractors



*Trustworthy, proactive, and highly organized



*Comfortable working US hours or overlapping time



*Committed to working exclusively with me, long-term





Your Role:



*Assist with construction and rental projects



*Communicate with people on my behalf



*Manage schedules, follow-ups, documents, and research





To Apply:



*Send a short intro, why this role excites you, and your 1–2 minute voice recording.



Let’s build something meaningful together.

title: Appointment Setter
description:
Company: Grow Patiently — 



Industry: Healthcare Marketing (Dental, Regenerative Medicine, Wellness)



Hours: Part-time to start, growing with the company



What You'll Do:



Call leads as they come in to ensure they book an appointment. Follow up with those who have booked to confirm details and answer any questions. You're the first voice our clients' patients hear — friendly, professional, and efficient.



Requirements (Non-Negotiable):



- 2+ years experience in sales or appointment setting

- Proven track record of results (be ready to share examples)

- Fluent English (spoken and written)



Ideal (Not Required):



- Experience in healthcare, medical, dental, or regenerative medicine

- Familiarity with Go High Level



This Role Is NOT For You If:



- You have less than 2 years direct appointment setting or sales experience

- You're a VA looking to expand your skills or "learn quickly"

- You're entry-level or looking for your first role





To Apply, send a brief note with:



- Your appointment setting or sales experience (years, industries)

- One example of results you've achieved

- Your hourly rate

title: Virtual Executive Assistant – Construction, Mining & Energy
description:
JOB DESCRIPTION:

This is not a typical EA role. We don’t need someone who takes notes and waits for instructions. We need a relentless, proactive operator who treats every hour of the executive’s time like capital deployed — if it doesn’t generate a return, it doesn’t make the schedule.

You will own the calendar. You will own the inbox. You will own the day. You will anticipate problems before they exist and eliminate bottlenecks before anyone notices them. You will protect the executive’s time ruthlessly and ensure every meeting, decision point, and commitment moves the business forward.

If you need to be told what to do twice, this isn’t for you. If you thrive on running the show behind the scenes and making things happen without being asked, keep reading.

What You Will Own:

Schedule & Calendar Management:

 ? Total ownership of the executive’s calendar — you d
 what gets time and what doesn’t

 ? Prioritise, schedule, reschedule, and decline meetings based on business impact, not politics

 ? Coordinate across multiple time zones with clients, contractors, project teams, and stakeholders across construction, mining, and energy sectors

 ? Build and enforce daily, weekly, and monthly routines that protect deep work time and maximise productivity

 ? Prepare daily briefing packs — what’s on, who’s attending, what decisions are needed, what background is required

 ? Anticipate scheduling conflicts and resolve them before they become problems

 & Communications Management:

 ? Manage and triage the executive’s inbox — filter, prioritise, flag, draft responses, and action items

 ? Draft correspondence, proposals, and communications on behalf of the executive in a professional, industry-appropriate tone

 ? Follow up on outstanding items relentlessly — nothing falls through the cracks on your watch

 ? Manage stakeholder communications with clients, contractors, government bodies, and internal teams

 ? Screen and manage phone calls, enquiries, and requests — gatekeep without creating friction

Task & Project Coordination:

 ? Track and drive action items, deadlines, and commitments to completion — you are the accountability engine

 ? Coordinate with project teams, PMO, document controllers, and operational staff to ensure deliverables are on track

 ? Manage travel arrangements including flights, accommodation, visas, site access, and FIFO logistics for remote and international project sites

 ? Prepare and compile meeting agendas, minutes, and action registers — then chase every single action to closure

 ? Support tender coordination, client submissions, and business development activities as required

 ? Manage expense reports, purchase orders, and basic financial administration

Business Operations Support:

 ? Maintain CRM entries, contact databases, and business development pipelines

 ? Prepare presentations, reports, and executive summaries for board meetings, client presentations, and internal reviews

 ? Conduct research on potential clients, projects, market opportunities, and competitors

 ? Manage confidential and sensitive information with absolute discretion

- Improve internal workflows through automation, templates, and structure

IDEAL CANDIDATE PROFILE

- Extremely organized and detail-oriented

- Tech-savvy and comfortable learning new systems quickly

- Proactive — doesn’t wait to be told what’s broken

PREFERRED EXPERIENCE

title: Online English Teachers (Near-Native Accent)
description:
About Pomelo Academy

Pomelo Academy is an innovative online international school dedicated to delivering high-quality education to students worldwide. We provide a dynamic and engaging learning environment, catering to individualized instruction that transcends geographical boundaries.



Job Description

We are seeking passionate and experienced Near-Native English-speaking Online K-12 Math and/or Science Teachers with verifiable teaching certifications. The ideal candidates will have strong academic backgrounds in Mathematics and/or Science, experience teaching young learners (ages 5–18), and a commitment to creating a supportive, inquiry-based, and engaging online learning environment.



Responsibilities



Deliver interactive and engaging Math and/or Science lessons to individuals and small groups of 2–6 students aged 5–18.

Teach using internationally recognized curricula such as A Closer Look, Glencoe Science, Pearson Interactive Science, NGSS-aligned resources, Singapore Math, or IB/AP/A Level Math programs.

Create age-appropriate lesson plans focused on conceptual understanding, inquiry, problem-solving, and real-world applications.

Incorporate visuals, multimedia, and hands-on virtual activities to make abstract concepts accessible and engaging.

Monitor student progress and provide timely feedback to students and parents.

Foster curiosity, discussion, and active learning in a safe and supportive space.



Qualifications



Professional teacher with at least 2 years of teaching experience (Kindergarten–Grade 12).

Must hold a valid teaching license/certification (e.g., Teaching License, State Certification). TESOL/TEFL is a plus.

Near-native English accent with excellent spoken and written communication skills.

Strong academic background in Mathematics and/or Science (Biology, Physics, Chemistry, General Science).

Experience teaching in public/international schools or reputable online platforms.

Familiarity with inquiry-based and/or interdisciplinary approaches (e.g., STEM/STEAM).

Comfortable working between 07:00–22:00 (Weekdays) and 9:00–22:00 (Weekends), GMT+8.

Proficiency with digital platforms such as ClassIn, Microsoft Office, and other educational technologies.

Must have a stable and fast internet connection and a PC/laptop with at least Windows 10 or Mac OS Catalina.



Benefits



Flexible working hours.

Opportunity to teach using globally respected Math and Science curricula.

Be part of an international, passionate team of educators.

Access to training and professional development.

Regular enrollment model (not a booking system), ensuring schedule stability and consistency

title: Customer Service Representative - Clear English Speaker
description:

mbers while maintaining clear and empathetic communication with the customer.
