title: Creative Strategist (DTC Performance Creative)
description:
Type: Full-time or Part-time (contract-to-hire OK)



Works with: Founder, Media Buyer, Video Editor, Designer



Primary channels: Meta 
/Instagram) + landing page / advertorial funnel



What you’ll own

- You’ll own end-to-end creative strategy for paid social: customer research ? messaging angles ? creative briefs ? AI statics production ? iteration based on performance.



Responsibilities



Market + customer research

- Research competitors, offers, funnels, and creative patterns

- Build customer avatar docs (pain points, desired outcomes, objections, language)

- Extract “winning hooks” and angles from ads, reviews, Reddit, comments, etc.



Creative ideation + direction

- Generate weekly/monthly creative roadmap (themes, angles, concepts)

- Write clear briefs for static + video (hook, structure, scenes, b-roll, overlays, CTA)

- Develop testing matrices (angle x hook x format x offer)



Copywriting

- Draft / improve landing page copy, advertorial copy, and quiz copy

- Write short-form ad copy (primary text, headlines, descriptions) and script outlines



Creative production (AI statics)

- Generate static concepts using AI tools (Midjourney / Nano Banana / OpenAI image, etc.)

- Ensure brand consistency (palette, font style, layout discipline)

- Deliver ready-to-launch assets to the editor/designer



Collaboration

- Work daily/weekly with the video editor and designer to execute briefs fast

- Provide clear feedback based on performance and brand guidelines



Performance iteration

- Review results (thumbstop/CTR/CPC/CPA/CVR) and propose next tests

- Kill/scale creative based on data and learning, not opinions





What “good” looks like in 30 days

- You deliver a clear creative testing plan and run weekly cycles

- You ship consistent briefs and assets without hand-holding

- Creative velocity increases (more variants, better structure, faster iteration)



Requirements

- Proven performance creative experience for DTC (Meta is a must)

- Strong copy instincts (hooks, objections, offers, landing pages)

- Ability to produce AI statics (or willingness to learn fast)

- Organized: can run creative testing like a system

- Comfortable working async with clear deliverables



Nice to have

- Experience with quiz funnels + advertorial funnels

- Direct-response editing instincts (UGC pacing, pattern interrupts)

- Understanding of compliance in sensitive categories (if applicable)



Deliverables you’ll produce

- Weekly creative plan + angle library

- 10–30 static variants/week (depending on scope)

- 5–15 video briefs/week

- Landing page + advertorial + quiz copy drafts/iterations

title: Learner Success Coordinator
description:
POSITION SUMMARY

The Learner Success Coordinator supports the onboarding and ongoing engagement of clients and their teams within the 10X Business Academy.  This role focuses on executing engagement plans, monitoring participation metrics, and maintaining proactive communication to ensure a positive learner experience.  The Coordinator partners closely with the Learner Success Manager to deliver consistent service, identify engagement risks early, and contribute to high client satisfaction and retention.



ABOUT CARDONE VENTURES

Our mission is to help business owners achieve their personal, professional, and financial goals through the growth of their businesses. We work in dozens of verticals and provide strategic business guidance through courses, live events, partnerships, and investments. Our core values are the backbone of our business and guide our hiring process: we are inspirational, accountable, transparent, disciplined, aligned, and results-oriented. This company operates nationally and is growing by the day.



SUCCESS LOOKS LIKE:

- Participation, course completion, and engagement metrics consistently meet or exceed benchmarks, demonstrating strong learner follow-through.

- Engagement gaps or client concerns are identified early and escalated appropriately, preventing negative impact on satisfaction or retention.

- Client records, tracking, and reporting are consistently accurate and timely, while the Coordinator demonstrates increasing ownership, confidence, and readiness for advancement to Learner Success Manager.



OBJECTIVES

- Support seamless onboarding of new clients and learners by coordinating orientation sessions, tracking setup completion, and ensuring timely follow-up communication.

- Monitor learner engagement metrics daily/weekly (course progress, participation, attendance, logins) and escalate risks to the Learner Success Manager.

- Maintain accurate and up-to-date client records in CRM and learning platforms.

- Conduct scheduled check-in calls and
 follow-ups using approved engagement frameworks.

- Execute engagement action plans developed by the Learner Success Lead.

- Identify disengagement patterns early and recommend proactive outreach strategies.

- Ensure client inquiries are responded to within established service-level timelines.

- Prepare client progress summaries and engagement reports for review by the Learner Success Lead.

- Coordinate scheduling of kick-off/accountability/coaching calls.

- Support accountability tracking by documenting team participation and milestone completion.

- Assist in renewal preparation by compiling engagement history and performance insights.

- Contribute to continuous improvement by documenting common learner challenges and recommending process enhancements.

- Uphold client confidentiality and data integrity standards.

- Demonstrate consistent adherence to communication and service quality standards.



COMPETENCIES

- Demonstrates patience, empathy, and professionalism in client interactions.

- Clear verbal and written communication in a global business environment.

- Follows structured workflows, checklists, and SOPs with accuracy.

- Builds rapport and trust with clients and learners.

- Consistently meets deadlines and follows through on commitments.

- Ability to interpret basic engagement metrics and recognize trends.

- Maintains high accuracy in documentation and reporting.

- Adjusts quickly to new systems, tools, and evolving processes.

- Works effectively with managers and cross-functional teams.

- Knows when to resolve independently and when to escalate.

- Effectively manages multiple client accounts simultaneously.

- Operates effectively in cross-border client relationships.

- Demonstrates willingness to learn coaching frameworks and client engagement strategies.

- Comfortable using CRM systems, online learning platforms, and productivity tools.



EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE

- Bachelor’s degree in Business Administration, Education, Communications, or related field preferred.

- 1–3 years of experience in customer service, account coordination, virtual support, BPO, or client-facing roles.

- Experience supporting global clients or working in remote environments is preferred.

- Familiarity with CRM systems and online learning platforms is an advantage.



PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS

Prolonged periods sitting at a desk and working on a computer





COMMITMENT TO DIVERSITY

As an equal opportunity employer committed to meeting the needs of a multigenerational and multicultural workforce Cardone Ventures recognizes that a diverse staff, reflective of our community, is an integral and welcome part of a successful and ethical business. We hire local talent at all levels regardless of race, color, religion, age, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation or disability, and actively foster inclusion in all forms both within our company and across interactions with clients, candidates and partners.

If this position caught your eye, send us your resume! For best consideration, include the job title and source where you found this position in the subject line of your
 to 
 a Cardone Ventures candidate? Please connect directly with your recruiter to discuss this opportunity.

title: Inbound Sales Representative (Fully Remote)
description:
Please Read the Whole Job Description Before Applying.



At Meadow, we’re reimagining end-of-life care - a $23B industry untouched by modern software or service thinking. In under a year, we became the largest cremation provider in Los Angeles, with 90+ NPS and hundreds of families served monthly. Now we’re scaling across the U.S. and hiring globally.



We believe great people live everywhere. Our team works across continents and time zones, grounded by shared values: high standards, deep empathy, and a drive to do work that matters.



Why join:

- Remote-first, global team: work from anywhere, be trusted to deliver

- Fair, transparent compensation: competitive pay, benchmarked globally.

- High expectations, high support:  we invest in training and growth

- Respect and humanity: no burnout culture, no hero worship

- Real-world impact: your work supports families when it matters most.



About the Role:

As an Inbound Sales Representative, you’ll be the first voice families hear when they reach out. You’ll guide them with clarity and compassion - no cold calls or pushy tactics, just meaningful conversations that help people make one of life’s most important decisions with confidence.



You’ll manage warm, inbound leads from first contact to close, helping families feel confident in their decisions and supported every step of the way. Every call is a chance to make someone’s life a little easier, and every conversation reflects our standard of unmatched hospitality.



A quick note, because many candidates wonder about it:

People often assume this work is emotionally heavy, but our team consistently finds it deeply meaningful and surprisingly uplifting. The role is rooted in hospitality, clarity, and human connection, not sadness. Rather than feeling heavy, the work offers a unique sense of purpose as part of a modern, compassionate company transforming an outdated industry and bringing dignity, transparency, and warmth to families across the country.



What You’ll Do:

- Handle warm inbound calls and close them end-to-end using Meadow’s consultative playbook.

- Guide families through our cremation options and deliver unmatched hospitality in every interaction.

- Follow up consistently via phone, text, and
 so families can make confident decisions.

- Hit revenue targets while maintaining strong close rates and high quality scores.

- Navigate a multi-tool workflow (HubSpot, Aircall, GSuite, Slack, internal case management) with ease.



Requirements & Qualifications:

- 2+ years of B2C sales experience

- Strong written and spoken English.

- Confident, empathetic communicator who explains clearly, listens well, and excels on the phone.

- Self-driven seller motivated by both impact and performance; emotionally steady and highly coachable.

- Comfortable working independently and managing a consistent follow-up rhythm.

- Familiarity with HubSpot or comparable CRMs (Salesforce, Zoho, etc.).



Bonus points if you:

- Have experience selling in high-trust spaces (insurance, healthcare, travel, etc.)

- Speak Spanish -  many of the families we serve do too



Details:

- Remote, full-time

- Compensation: $6-$9/hr USD OTE

- Total compensation includes a base rate plus bonus (tied to  performance and overall team success).

- Tools: HubSpot (CRM), Aircall (phone), Slack, and our case management system

- Schedule: This is a full-time role with 8-hour shifts and a consistent weekly schedule.

- Days

- Weekend availability is required. All schedules include at least one weekend day.

- Available shift windows:

- AM: Start between 6:00–8:00am EST

- PM: Start between 2:00–4:00pm EST

- Night: Start between 8:00–10:00pm EST



Why You’ll Love Working With Us:

- Benefits: PTO, 10 Paid Holidays, Paid Training, Fully remote

- Global collaboration: Work with teammates around the world.

- Learn more about our Global teams here: 

- Career Growth in Sales & Tech: A chance to grow your career in sales and tech while helping build something meaningful

- Purpose-driven work: Make a real difference during one of life’s most meaningful transitions

- Supportive, growth-minded team – Bring your sales drive and eagerness to learn; we’ll support you every step of the way



Apply Now:

We’re just getting started, and we’re looking for people who want to grow with us. If you’re excited about making an impact, building meaningful relationships, and launching a successful career in sales and tech, apply today. Even if you don’t meet every qualification, we encourage you to apply - your passion and potential matter more than checking every box.



Apply here:

title: Pre-Chart Preparation
description:
ABOUT 10X HEALTH SYSTEM

10X Health System is a pioneering company at the forefront of the health and wellness industry, dedicated to revolutionizing the way individuals approach their personal health and well-being. With a philosophy rooted in the principle that optimal health is the foundation for a life lived to the fullest, 10X Health provides cutting-edge solutions and personalized health plans designed to empower individuals to achieve and maintain peak physical and mental performance.



The company's comprehensive approach to health combines the latest advances in medical science, nutrition, fitness, and technology to offer a suite of services that include state-of-the-art diagnostic testing, individualized treatment protocols, and ongoing support from a team of world-class health professionals. 10X Health's commitment to innovation and results has established it as a leader in the health optimization space, catering to those who strive to push the boundaries of what is possible in their health journey.



POSITION SUMMARY

The Pre-Chart Preparation Coordinator plays a vital role in setting up each patient encounter for clinical success. This position is responsible for reviewing patient intake forms, health histories, and supporting documents to accurately transcribe relevant details into the clinical note prior to the appointment. By ensuring the provider has a complete, organized, and ready-to-review chart, this role helps streamline the visit experience, reduce administrative burden on providers, and enhance overall clinical efficiency.



Ideal candidates are detail-oriented, organized, and comfortable navigating medical documentation systems to ensure accuracy and compliance while maintaining patient confidentiality.



OBJECTIVES

• Review patient health history and intake forms prior to scheduled appointments.

• Transcribe relevant clinical details (medical history, medications, allergies, lifestyle information, prior diagnoses, etc.) into the appropriate sections of the patient’s EHR chart.

• Ensure accuracy, consistency, and completeness of data entered into the pre-chart note.

• Identify missing, unclear, or incomplete information and flag for provider or clinical coordinator review.

• Collaborate with providers, wellness concierges, and medical coordinators to prepare patient charts for same-day and future appointments.

• Maintain compliance with HIPAA and all internal documentation standards.

Verify that all required forms and consents are uploaded and properly tagged in the EHR.

• Support audit readiness by maintaining clear, accurate, and time-stamped documentation.

• Contribute to workflow efficiency by meeting daily and weekly pre-chart completion goals.



COMPETENCIES

• Strong understanding of medical terminology, health history documentation, and intake workflows.

• Excellent data entry skills with a high degree of accuracy and attention to detail.

• Ability to manage multiple charts simultaneously and prioritize tasks effectively.

• Clear written and verbal communication skills for internal coordination.

• Proactive problem-solver with a commitment to quality and timeliness.

• Familiarity with electronic health record (EHR) systems and documentation protocols.

• Commitment to patient confidentiality and regulatory compliance standards.

• Ability to adapt to evolving workflows and system updates.



EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE

• Certified Medical Assistant (MA), LPN, or equivalent healthcare credential preferred.

• Minimum of 1–2 years in a healthcare, clinical support, or administrative documentation role.

• Experience with EHR systems required (DrChrono or similar preferred).

• Familiarity with patient intake processes, chart preparation, or scribe work highly valued.



PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS

Prolonged periods sitting at a desk and working on a computer



COMMITMENT TO DIVERSITY



As an equal opportunity employer committed to meeting the needs of a multigenerational and multicultural workforce Cardone Ventures recognizes that a diverse staff, reflective of our community, is an integral and welcome part of a successful and ethical business. We hire local talent at all levels regardless of race, color, religion, age, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation or disability, and actively foster inclusion in all forms both within our company and across interactions with clients, candidates and partners.



If this position caught your eye, send us your resume! For best consideration, please complete the online application form:
